reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC BRAZIL DEBT POSES THO

text.title: BRAZIL DEBT POSES THORNY ISSUE FOR U S BANKS
text.author: By Cal Mankowski Reuters
text.body: CitiCorp CCI appears to be digging heels tough negotiations over billions dollars loans Brazil owes to money center banks Wall Street analysts I view as pre negotiation posturing analyst Carole Berger Cyrus J Lawrence Inc referring to both Brazil Citicorp Brazil recently stopped paying interest on commercial bank debt Today CitiCorp first quarter income be reduced by dlrs after tax if lists loans as non performing status Citicorp filed K form Securities Exchange Commission indicating material change financial situation Citicorp saying you can t scare us threats we ll make your loans non performing right now Berger loans to be treated as non performing after days without payment CitiCorp only situation be reviewed at end current quarter Berger asserted Brazil doing own politicking by talking to U S regulators trying to drive wedge between U S European banks Analyst Lawrence Cohn Merrill Lynch Co unlikely situation be resolved until second half year Ultimately Brazilians going to to pay up on all interest they owe Cohn The real issue rescheduling debt terms Another question whether or International Monetary Fund can help Brazil new austerity program Stocks money center banks were mostly down fractions late dealings One trader most stocks group bounced off their lows by midday as investors took news stride Cohn bank stocks may be risky until numbers on non performing loans reported each bank But he investors looking ahead six to months might want to buy at present levels tremendous fundamental values group Analyst Robert Gordon Shearson Lehman Brothers Inc Manufacturers Hanover Corp MHC greatest exposure to Brazilian loans any New York bank terms percentage earnings He his only two recommendations currently among New York banks J P Morgan Co JPM Bankers Trust Co BT happen to least exposure Gordon his positive opinion on J P Morgan Bankers Trust merely response to fact two lower exposure to Brazilian loans than other banks fact he there s chance those banks could get more involved future He noted Morgan already set up brokerage subsidiary to deal loans to less developed countries I don t see any reason to change full year earnings estimates Frederick Meinke analyst at E F Hutton Co He thinks confrontation Brazil could end replay situation occurred Argentina Meinke noted case Argentina loans became non accruing couple quarters but then when banks came to agreement Argentina all back interest paid What did distort quarterly earnings pattern he He case Brazil write offs loans worst case outcome highly unlikely He noted Brazil country diversified economy going through some economic upheaval after transition military to civilian government The countries Latin America too much debt relative to their ability to service John Mason Interstate Securities We ve been fiddling around these problems five years hour growing late He up to now banks reduced their spreads cut interest rates internally extended maturities none these measures been enough He expects re classification as much as third loans as non accruing he sees partial write downs some loans Nevertheless Mason thinks money center bank stocks could be poised short term rally spokesman at First Chicago Corp FNB premature to put Brazil s loans on cash basis It our expectation economic development allow Brazil to meet debt spokesman Bankers Trust New York be premature to make decision Several other banks queried by Reuters much same thing spokesman at Manufacturers Hanover noted billion dlrs loan exposure to Brazil only billion subject to Brazil s unilateral moratorium on repayment interest

reuters.unknown: F A RM f reute r f BC AFTER G ROUND ONE

text.title: AFTER G ROUND ONE GOES TO CENTRAL BANKS
text.author: By Claire Miller Reuters
text.body: Central banks easily beaten back foreign exchange market s first test industrialized nations recent pact to stabilize currencies analysts active trading week market pushed dollar sterling Canadian dollar Australian dollar higher But operators got their fingers burned as one by one central banks signalled their displeasure So far G been roaring success said James O Neill financial markets economist at Marine Midland Bank NA The central banks sending strong signals they won t tolerate any kind momentum building behind currencies added senior corporate trader at one U K bank On February finance ministers central bank governors U S Japan West Germany France U K Group Five plus Canada signed accord under they agreed to cooperate closely to foster stability exchange rates around prevailing levels agreement viewed by many market as attempt to put floor under dollar after sizeable two year decline against major world currencies initially traders indicated their respect accord by refraining pushing dollar lower But by Wednesday dollar climbed to more than marks five pfennigs above levels Friday before G accord move aided by indications U S economy picked up steam February at same time as West German economy regressing But dealers Federal Reserve Bank New York gave traders sharp reminder G pact encompassed idea limiting inordinate dollar gains as well as declines Dealers differed as to whether U S central bank actually intervened to sell dollars above marks or simply telephoned dealers to ask quotes enquire trading conditions But dollar quickly backed off hovered today around marks The market surprised Fed showed face so soon Marine Midland NA s O Neill Also on Wednesday London dealers Bank England intervened open market to sell sterling as U K currency rose to dlrs compared dlrs before G pact Sterling along other high yield currencies like Australian dollar Canadian dollar favor after traders surmised chance intervention pursuant to Paris currency accord left limited room profit plays on dollar mark dollar yen pound also boosted by suggestions improving U K economy anticipation popular British budget on March public opinion polls showing good chances incumbent Conservative party any general election There real run on sterling Anne Mills Shearson Lehman Brothers Inc Sterling traded today around dlrs down dlrs night slid to marks yesterday peak recently There s been some heavy profit taking on sterling mark ahead next Tuesday s U K budget James McGroarty Discount Corp As speculators detected presence U S British central banks they acclerated their shift into Canadian Australian dollars But here too they were stymied Bank Canada acted to slow currency s rise Canadian dollar traded at per U S dollar today down yesterday Australian Reserve Bank using Fed as agent sold Australian dollars U S yesterday dealers Australian dollar fell to low U S cents today high Thursday Analysts central banks moves to stifle sudden upward movement leave market uncertain next step Today focus shifted to yen held to very tight range against dollar several months dollar fell to yen night Analysts yen also gained as traders unwound long sterling short mark positions established lately Because change perceptions health German economy funds those unwinding operations ending up yen dealer at one U K bank Recent West German data shown falling industry orders lower industrial output slowing employment gains Moreover yen benefitting as Japanese entities who invested heavily overseas example Australian financial instruments repatriate their profits ahead end Japanese fiscal year on March Noting dollar yen rate sense most controversial one because large U S trade deficit Japan analysts stage could be set another test dollar s downward scope against Japanese currency latest review foreign exchange market through end January Federal Reserve revealed intervened to protect dollar against yen on January On day dollar fell as low as yen Sure Fed bought dollars near yen level January But market to bear mind time marches on situation changes McGroarty Discount

text.title: BRAZIL WARNS CREDITORS AGAINST RETALIATION
text.body: Central Bank president Francisco Gros possible retaliation by Brazil s creditors be intelligent measure because affect both sides If our creditors considered retaliation Brazil lose capacity to export thus never be able to pay debt Gros news conference Gros during their day globe trotting tour several countries he Finance Minister Dilson Funaro warned creditors Brazil could no longer continue representing role merely exporter capital We made very clear to our creditors we must find other means to pay our debt We told them we wish to pay but first we must make sure country grows Gros We pointed out to them two years Brazil paid billion dlrs just interest rates while only receiving two billion dlrs new loans over similar period Gros reiterated Brazil accept interference International Monetary Fund IMF as creditors suggested The performance IMF over years been convenient to our needs important institution but we do accept to monitor our economy he The banks welcome us going to IMF We welcome if they pardoned half our debt Gros Brazil announced suspension interest payment billion dlrs owed to commercial foreign banks on February No deadline established renewal payment Our major commitment country s growth Therefore we need more money to invest on new projects Gros He before announcement suspension interest payment Brazil paying dlrs month to commercial foreign creditors We can say at least we saving some money he Gros Brazil submitted specific proposals to creditors instead hopes proposals come through bilateral negotiations Central Bank president he be going next week to Washington to take part meeting Inter American Development Bank Brasilia sources linked to Presidency Brazil preparing new program economic readjustment to strengthen negotiations on billion dlr foreign debt sources new program could be announced by end month calls basically preservation country s growth

text.title: TRADING RANGE LIKELY TO CONTINUE IN DEBT FUTURES
text.author: By Brad Schade Reuters
text.body: U S economic data due out next week unlikely to hold any surprises shake U S interest rate futures out their relatively narrow trading range months financial analysts People don t seem to any firm conviction current strength economy or Federal Reserve doing anything Drexel Burnham Lambert analyst Norman Mains narrow range trading also taking toll on trading volume he noted We ve decline activity as recent economic statistics greatly changed people s viewpoints on interest rates Mains data provided clear cut view economy coupled dampened activity foreign exchange markets after Paris initiative made less than ebullient market action Mains He added however Treasury bond futures could be retracement after recent rise as they near top trading range My view economy remains relatively strong market participants see current prices unjustified Mains Refco Inc senior vice president Michael Connery also noted market showing very little momentum lacks retail interest All movement occurs at opening afterwhich volume dwindles momentum fades Connery Although data during week mildly positive bond prices small rise February producer prices downward revisions January retail sales industrial production were not real exciting Prudential Bache analyst Fred Leiner There no one factor push us through highs at moment Leiner Next week s revision to fourth quarter U S Gross national Product also likely to be little interest to market Kleinwort Benson chief financial economist Sam Kahan Still forecasts first quarter GNP could play role direction bond prices over next month Kahan his early estimate first quarter growth around three pct due largely to buildup inventories reflected January inventory data Friday showed largest increase since The key question be whether there large increase first quarter GNP but whether any increase sustainable or one shot deal Kahan He sizable increase first quarter GNP stemming increase inventories be drag on second quarter growth If case GNP second quarter could ease back to one to two pct growth rate Kahan

text.title: MEXICO TEMPORARILY HALTS DEBT EQUITY SWAPS
text.author: By Alan Wheatley Reuters
text.body: Mexico temporarily suspended debt equity swap program move some bankers see as attempt to increase pressure on reluctant foreign banks to participate new billion dlr loan country scheme gives foreign firms access to cheap pesos to finance investment Mexico likely to resume soon after loan package signed on March But move further indication strains developed between Mexico banks because difficulty syndicating huge loan bankers Bankers Mexico suspended swap program on February Adolfo Hegewisch Mexico s Undersecretary Commerce confirmed swap program been halted but he told Euromoney conference on debt equity swaps Mexico been forced to act because been inundated applications Between January February firms applied to do debt equity conversion compared between May December We were accustomed to receive so much work Hegewisch who responsible foreign investment Mexico Bankers applications totalling two billion dlrs piled up at finance ministry wants to limit amount swaps to dlrs month But some bankers who declined to be identified halt also suited Mexico as keep up pressure on banks during final campaign to persuade all creditors worldwide to participate loan Over pct loan been subscribed but dozens smaller banks still baulking Assistant U S Treasury Secretary David Mulford yesterday reluctance these banks nearly jeopardized deal at one stage The Mexicans basically We re going to subsidize foreigners until we deal one banker Other bankers however Mexico s motives were so sinister suspension mainly due to absence top ministry officials New York debt talks They want to focus on deal they wanted banks to focus on deal one source Apart present disruption bankers company officials Mexican debt equity scheme been huge success Frank Fountain Assistant Treasurer at Chrysler Corp dlr swap made December gone so smoothly Chrysler plans more Chrysler working through Manufacturters Hanover Trust Co bought Mexican public sector debt face value dlrs mainly European banks cost dlrs cash paper then presented paper to Mexico s central bank received equivalent dlrs worth pesos invested local subsidiary to produce cars export to North America Susan Segal senior vice president Manufacturers Hanover swaps only reduce Mexico s debt burden but help to recapitalize local industries may been squeezed out local capital markets Fountain even large well established firm such as Chrysler found difficult to arrange long term peso financing on reasonable terms Mexico Industrial companies done most swaps to date Hegewisch many applications now pending investments electronic chemical industries Japanese Korean firms showing particular interest But interest spreading Segal Manufacturers Hanover been authorized to convert part own portfolio loans into equity investment Mexican hotels She sums involved considerable but gave no details bank also looking into joint ventures manufacturing trading companies Segal added as part agreement banks be signed next week Mexican residents be allowed to participate scheme hitherto reserved foreign firms hope some billion dlrs estimated to be held abroad be repatriated

text.title: MAJOR DIFFERENCES RESOLVED AT RUBBER PACT TALKS
text.author: By Claude Fillet
text.body: Negotiators at United Nations conference on new International Natural Rubber Agreement INRA agreed on basic elements new pact conference chairman Manaspas Xuto We resolved major differences opinion he told Reuters Xuto way now cleared drafting new accord to replace current one expires October Xuto I welcome friendly cooperative atmosphere prevailed without interruption since talks began Monday It my hope delegations go back home try to ratify new agreement he added renegotiation conference under auspices U N Conference on Trade Development UNCTAD fourth such meeting two years Xuto producers consumers agreed on four points Regular price reviews be held every months Previously consumers were proposing month intervals between price reviews instead current pact If average daily market indicator prices over six months prior to review below or above lower intervention price or upper intervention price reference price be automatically revised downwards or upwards by five pct unless International Natural Rubber Organisation council decides on higher percentage If buffer stock purchases or sales reach tonnes reference price be lowered or raised by three pct unless council decides on higher percentage If buffer stock reaches tonnes price at additional contingency stock tonnes brought into operation be two Malaysian Singapore cents above floor price or cents floor price be breached Throughout talks producers adamantly resisted consumer proposal to lower floor price cents if buffer stock currently tonnes rose to tonnes proposal initiated by U S withdrawn night setting stage compromise Legal drafting provisions start next week formal adoption new accord by countries taking part conference expected to take place on March current conference widely seen as chance to clinch deal Three previous attempts to negotiate new five year pact failed round breaking down October over consumer demands tighter controls buffer stock United States Japan West Germany France Italy Britain major consumers UNCTAD s latest estimates project increase pct rubber prices year pct

text.body: President Reagan first time admitted he wrong to sell arms to Iran initiative four months ago plunged him into worst crisis his six year old presidency He made admission weekly radio address while defending role played by Secretary State George Shultz Defence Secretary Caspar Weinberger affair He In case Iranian arms sale matter both Secretary Shultz Secretary Weinberger advised me strongly to pursue initiative I weighed their advice but decided end initiative worth risk went forward As we now know turned out they were right I wrong But they discharged their responsibilities as my advisers as my subordinates he Since scandal broke November Shultz Weinberger they told Reagan their opposition to deal were fully informed effort carried out by National Security Council members They also they were unaware diversion millions dollars profits arms sales to Nicaraguan contra rebels who been fighting leftist Managua government six years

text.body: U S Commerce Secretary Malcolm Baldrige predicted Congress pass reasonable trade bill year tough protectionist legislation could prompt trade war The mood Congress right now as tough on trade as I ve ever seen six years Washington Baldrige television interview I think we ll still be able to get reasonable trade bill out spite because whole Congress trying to work together administration but there hardening trade attitude he President Reagan opposes protectionist legislation but agreed to support trade bill when became apparent opposition Democrats pass such legislation However Baldrige warned measures penalise trading partners such as Japan South Korea Taiwan failing to cut their trade surpluses U S Could lead to retaliation he he urge Reagan to veto any such bill When asked if there rising danger worldwide trade war Baldrige Yes I don t think there s any question

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC PANEL HEAD SAYS MARCO

text.title: PANEL HEAD SAYS MARCOS STILL CONTROLS LARGE FUNDS
text.author: By Chaitanya Kalbag Reuters
text.body: The head Philippine panel charged recovering illegal wealth accumulated by former President Ferdinand Marcos his associates they still controlled large funds circulating country s economy Ramon Diaz Chairman Presidential Commission on Good Government PCGG told Reuters interview There every reason to believe cronies President Marcos his family were able to hide millions millions pesos before they fled As matter fact we been able to get hold crates newly printed currency Diaz did give figures but We believe they still lot funds These funds they use coming elections These funds they used to stage those coups He referring to congressional elections scheduled May to three coup attempts faced by President Corazon Aquino since she toppled Marcos year ago Diaz PCGG so far recovered cash property valued at eight billion pesos sequestered shares stock at least firms We achieved more than what we thought we could achieve one year he added PCGG set up by Aquino February sweeping powers sequestration seizure inspection bank accounts Diaz panel s main task to gather evidence legal prosecution But we to sequester before we file case legal objection because they say we shoot first before we ask questions he He dividends seized shares were held trust funds pending court verdicts adding several Marcos associates made confessions their wealth He did name them They very concerned afraid if their names appear something may happen to them he government week announced businessman Antonio Floirendo associate Marcos known as banana king turned over pesos cash to PCGG promised to surrender titles to property New York Hawaii worth another pesos return PCGG lifted freeze sequestration orders on Floirendo s properties Diaz there were already similar preliminary agreements another Marcos associate Roberto Benedicto He Benedicto surrendered control several newspapers radio television stations agreed to PCGG control boards bank hotel he owned Philippines Diaz PCGG based estimates illegal wealth on income tax returns land titles Marcos associates Anything over above reported income s what we to recover he He decision by PCGG week to probe street certificates held by brokers at Manila s two stock exchanges prompted by suspicion illegal funds were circulation Street certificates describe securities held name broker or another nominee instead customer so as to permit easy trading or transfer Share prices at two exchanges reacted nervously Tuesday when news probe leaked composite index at Manila Stock Exchange fell points to while at Makati Stock Exchange slipped points to close at There slight recovery following day presidents two exchanges appealed to Diaz to carry out probe discreetly so investors were scared away saying street certificates did necessarily indicate anomalous transactions It s unfortunate news probe leaked out to papers Diaz Diaz PCGG suspicions were aroused by stock market boom over past year Manila Stock Exchange composite index jumped pct to One our functions to see to these assets we sequestered do go right back into hands Marcos cronies he We want to make sure these stock exchanges being manipulated by cronies because maybe they want to launder their pesos why prices just skyrocketing Diaz PCGG limit probe to sequestered stock brewery giant San Miguel Corp Philippine Long Distance Telephone Co mining conglomerate Benguet Corp Oriental Petroleum Minerals Corp Shares four companies among most frequently traded on two stock exchanges Diaz at meeting heads two exchanges Thursday PCGG act prudently investigation street certificates adding panel supported government efforts to create favourable investment climate

text.title: SAUDI OIL MINISTER SEES NO NEED TO ALTER OPEC PACT
text.author: By Philip Shehadi Reuters
text.body: Saudi Arabian Oil Minister Hisham Nazer OPEC s December agreement to stabilise oil prices at dlrs barrel being implemented satisfactorily there no immediate need to change Nazer interview Reuters television news agency Visnews Saudi Arabia producing around three barrels per day bpd crude oil well below OPEC quota Saudi Arabia world s largest oil exporter continue to restrain production as long as other OPEC members adhere to pact Nazer nation OPEC agreed December to cut production ceiling by pct to bpd abide by fixed prices averaging dlrs barrel February Nazer his first interview since succeeding Ahmed Zaki Yamani October I do foresee any need new measures before th June when our next OPEC meeting take place as scheduled Nazer OPEC producing below bpd all members were abiding by agreements We ve heard news every now then violations but they were at all verified he OPEC production curbs boosted world oil prices year low around eight dlrs barrel August to near dlrs after announcement December pact Spot market prices slipped some two dlrs February but firmed past two weeks to near OPEC levels as traders gained confidence OPEC price output discipline Nazer Saudi Arabia continue to produce below bpd quota if necessary to defend dlr price As long as all OPEC members adhere to program as devised December Saudi Arabia continue to adhere to agreement he Current production three bpd includes oil Neutral Zone shared Kuwait but sales floating storage Nazer King Fahd Saudi Arabia interview Reuters Visnews on March kingdom wanted oil price stability called on non OPEC producers to avoid harmful competition OPEC Saudi Arabia doesn t decide prices by itself but certainly desires price stability he Nazer output level did mean kingdom returned to role swing producer within OPEC Saudi Arabia allowed output to sink as low as two bpd August to compensate slack demand over production by some OPEC states Saudi Arabia playing role being played by OPEC membership as whole because reduction bpd share OPEC market being shared by other members OPEC Nazer Nazer OPEC estimated demand oil during third quarter year be around bpd But he if circumstances changed I am sure then OPEC members consult each other take necessary measures Oil analysts say OPEC pact could come under strain when demand petroleum products generally falls northern hemisphere spring summer Nazer he satisfied extent cooperation non OPEC producers Norway Egypt Soviet Union agreed to help OPEC by restraining production or exports after he visited them on OPEC s behalf earlier year We did ask any country to do anything These were programmes they thought were necessary to stabilise market conditions to help themselves attain better pricing conditions Nazer He up to countries declined to cooperate such as Britain to come up their own proposals if they saw fit

text.body: Tense trade relations U S Japan concern foreign impact proposed European Community EC tax on edible oils fats expected to dominate talks by EC foreign ministers here tomorrow EC diplomats Britain demanded early debate on EC Executive Commission s proposal to impose hefty tax on domestic imported oils fats attempt to head off proposal sees as extremely damaging to EC foreign relations proposal most controversial part reform package due to be discussed by EC farm ministers later month EC s Common Agricultural Policy widely seen as root cause EC s persistent financial problems tensions major trading partners proposal described by promoters as stabilisation program penalise new sector going into massive overproduction complement proposals to cut cereals dairy production rather than straight forward tax They say only curb growth oils fats production prevent imports filling any vaccum left by fall EC output but also save EC some two billion European Currency Units over two billion dlrs farm costs provoked strong protests domestic producers as well as foreign exporters led by United States diplomats protests been received most corners developing developed world ranging Senegal Malaysia Indonesia to Brazil Argentina Canada Iceland Norway proposal little chance approval by EC governments West Germany as strongly opposed to as Britain Denmark Netherlands Portugal also unconvinced political or economic wisdom Even Mediterranean countries such as Italy France Greece backed similar proposals past did seem as enthusiastic now because olive oil been added to list products affected But diplomats protectionist lobby U S elsewhere using proposal as excuse to promote anti EC action foreign ministers debate should demonstrate strength feeling against proposal within EC deprive oponents argument ministers were also due to discuss proposals U S Congress range protecionist legislation such as bill curb EC textile exports diplomats ministers were expected to strongly back Commission warning to Washington such bill if enacted provoke swift EC retaliation

text.title: SAUDI BUSINESSMEN TO DISCUSS PRIVATE SECTOR
text.author: By Stephen Jukes Reuters
text.body: Saudi Arabian business leaders assembled conference aimed at thrashing out problems facing private sector kingdom s oil dependent economy meeting some top businessmen across Saudi Arabia comes at time guarded optimism industry commerce following OPEC pact to boost world oil prices four day conference resort town high mountains above Tihamah plain stretching to Red Sea been organised by Saudi Arabia s chambers commerce Finance Minister Mohammed Ali Abal Khail Commerce Minister Suleiman Abdulaziz al Salim attend first day Bankers businessmen conference air problems facing commerce industry after year s slide oil prices examine ways to promote higher investment private sector sorely short finance Government planners long recognised Saudi Arabia world s largest crude exporter needs to foster private enterprise to diversify oil based economy fledgling private sector hard hit by Middle East recession as early as several big manufacturing trading companies ran into problems repaying loans Renewed optimism year stems largely accord reached by OPEC December to curb oil output boost prices to benchmark level dlrs per barrel oil prices recovering Saudi Arabia went ahead at turn year long delayed budget plans incorporating billion riyal deficit to be bridged by drawing down foreign reserves simple act publishing budget restored measure confidence to business community Some share prices risen by more than pct since November while banks generally reporting slowdown number new non performing loans But all bankers convinced One senior corporate finance manager Riyadh Banks still reluctant to lend There certainly more optimism air but I am sure if firmly based Some businessmen bankers point out government spending still under tight control non oil economy may still be contracting Capital expenditure on large projects been cut sharply U S Embassy report on Saudi Arabia published just before budget While industrialisation continued to be one government s highest priorities recession payments problem lack financing reduced Saudi foreign investor interest industry lack fresh investment expected to be major issue among businessmen gathered here Official figures show number new licences industrial ventures fell pct six months to March compared same period Lending by Saudi Industrial Development Fund major source industry backing fallen steadily since Trading companies also been hit some caught huge inventories construction equipment as recession bit Some firms laid off workers cut bloated inventories Others effectively been liquidated few reached agreement bankers to extend debt repayments latest rescheduling shipping to hotels conglomerate REDEC negotiators just initialled draft accord to restructure payments on billion riyals bank debt Bankers businessmen conference also likely to discuss apparent reluctance U S British firms to step up investment kingdom British government delegation just left Riyadh after holding preliminary talks on ways offsetting huge Saudi outlay on defence contract to supply fighter aircraft worth five billion stg

text.body: Leading industrial nations meet again next month to review their accord on currency stability but U S Officials financial markets convinced now countries live up to commitments to speed up economic growth narrow currency movements recent weeks strongly suggests six leading industrial countries tamed normally unruly financial markets next month s talks seem likely to build on stability Reagan administration official Paris agreement month main reason markets were calm But he interview financial markets also understood That all six countries concluded measures to be taken over period time future should foster stability exchange rates around current levels fact what happened since Paris Monetary analysts stability been helped part by decision industrial nations to bury hatchet cease to quarrel over short term policy objectives Instead they focused on medium term policy goals but left room to adjust their agreements periodic meetings official refused to comment however on whether agreement included secret pact to consider further coordinated interest rate cuts measure industrial nations taken jointly several times past year On February United States Japan West Germany France Britain Canada agreed major currencies were within ranges broadly reflecting underlying economic conditions given commitments by Washington to cut budget deficit by Toyko Bonn to boost economic growth shake up strengthen U S Position future international talks I think these changes strengthen President s hand politically stronger he politically better off we Congress better off we international fora official Administration economic policymaker So be beneficial to continued conduct our initiatives But official also Administration resist calls tax increase to cut budget deficit target Europeans say crucial to help curb economic instability week dealers Federal Reserve intervened to stop dollar rising against mark breached to dollar British authorities also understood to intervened to curb sterling s strength International monetary sources say finance ministers central bankers who review market performance their own economic prospects reassemble again Washington just before April policymaking meeting International Monetary Fund sources Italy refused to join Paris pact invited back by Treasury Secretary James Baker Since Paris there signs West German growth slowing while U S Officials they were giving Japan until April to show economic stimulus package offing Signs concern German prospects emerged recently when Bundesbank central bank president Karl Otto Poehl told bankers he consider cutting West German interest rates if Fed ready to follow suit Reagan Administration official show there been some change approach on part central bank Germany But he declined to comment on prospects action by Fed Bundesbank If there such provision private if I talked no longer be private official who asked to be identified Public comments by Fed officials suggest central bank keeping credit conditions broadly unchanged but if major economies continue to show sluggish growth U S Trade deficit remains stubbornly high further coordinated action could be on April agenda

text.title: PHILIPPINES ONGPIN OPTIMISTIC ON DEBT TALKS
text.author: By ALAN WHEATLEY REUTERS
text.body: Philippines finance minister Jaime Ongpin he cautiously optimistic accord on debt rescheduling be reached commercial bank creditors as he prepared third week talks starting Monday One can never be too optimistic but I m cautiously optimistic we can get agreement We think we re close to deal Ongpin told Reuters by telephone He he received new proposal banks late Friday spent weekend evaluating other members Philippine delegation Ongpin declined to disclose details banks new offer bankers also declined to be specific ahead their next meeting Ongpin on Monday But one senior banker he too guardedly optimistic deal could be struck possibly by end week Still at heart talks Ongpin s offer to pay part country s interest bill Philippine Investment Notes PINs instead cash bank creditors advisory committee led by Manufacturers Hanover Trust Co rejected concept as originally drafted but counter proposal made on Friday contains revised version bankers Manila seeking to reschedule billion dlrs total debt billion wants to pay London Interbank Offered Rate LIBOR cash margin above LIBOR PINs These dollar denominated notes be sold by banks at discount to multi national firms then convert them at face value central bank thus receiving subsidized pesos use funding government approved investments Effectively foreign companies be paying interest margin above LIBOR Philippines conserve foreign exchange enjoy investment inflows reducing marginally need to seek new bank loans But banks rejected PINs proposal original form fearing regulatory accounting problems They were also reluctant to veer principle interest should be paid cash paper fearing other debtor nations emulate idea bankers Ongpin sweetened his original offer by guaranteeing his government redeem notes at pct over LIBOR if there no buyer secondary market week banks came under pressure to accept when senior U S Officials endorsed as fully consistent Treasury Secretary James Baker s debt strategy But banking sources margin over LIBOR still sticking point After Venezuela clinched revised rescheduling agreement month at pct over LIBOR some New York bankers imediately claimed pct should be seen as new benchmark debtor needs no new loans current on interest repaying some principal Philippines meets first two criteria but third

text.title: GERMAN BANKING AUTHORITIES WEIGH SWAP REGULATIONS
text.author: By Alice Ratcliffe Reuters
text.body: German banking authorities weighing rules banks off balance sheet activities attempt to cope growing volume sophisticated capital market instruments banking sources Interest rate currency swaps currency options under closest scrutiny if revisions made they may resemble regulation jointly proposed by U S U K To Japan Juergen Becker director Bundesbank s division banking law credit supervision U S British proposals were interesting but declined to elaborate But banking sources West Germany more likely to produce own conclusions than to adopt foreign proposals There no formal plan yet but talks latter stages one representative German Banking Association Cologne Bankers expect rule changes year All alterations must be approved by Bundesbank West Germany s four major banking associations Federal Banking Supervisory Office Talks been slowed by fact fundamental changes require revision Germany s credit law been effect since Authorities favour reinterpreting credit law to fit present circumstances order to avoid long parliamentary political process changing banking sources Since beginning banking law limited banks lending to times shareholders equity plus reserves on consolidated basis But lending ratios do extend to several newer instruments such as spot forward currency contracts currency interest swaps commercial paper programs currency options interest rate futures foreign currencies various innovative types interest rate hedges sources main value U S U K Proposals lay differentiating between different types risk factor instance placing greater weight on currency swaps than interest swaps But even if German banking authorities agree some assessments swaps they disagree on how to find balance sheet equivalents risk U S British proposals include complicated series formulae assessing stream payments involved swaps whose ultimate risk borne by financial intermediary especially when counterparties remain anonymous so called market to market value But German authorities likely to consider much too complex to base their evaluation instead on schedule lending ratings assigned according to creditworthiness borrowers involved sources weightings also likely if lending ratios extended to include banks securities portfolios zero public authorities pct domestic banks pct foreign banks pct other foreign non bank borrowers further complication more flexible definitions equity allowed U S U K May put German banks at competitive disadvantage sources Stricter definitions here also mean use version U S U K Proposals could far exceed intent U S British authorities sources One specialist Dresdner Bank AG long dated foreign exchange forward transaction could instance be brought under same rule as cross currency swap despite fact risk may be entirely different How new regulations affect foreign banks here uncertain Many converted to full subsidiary status applied full banking licence over two years order to lead manage mark eurobonds But as their equity capital fairly small tight lending ratios severely hamper foreign banks freedom movement particularly growing business currency swaps if they required to include more transactions balance sheet sources added

text.body: Japan should step up pace financial liberalisation if wants to become world financial centre equal to New York or London leading U S banker For Tokyo to become third link international capital markets triangle need to create environment more hospitable to international finance than currently exists Robert Binney senior vice president Chase Manhattan Bank N A Told group Japanese members parliament financial leaders Binney Japan must liberalise financial markets just to attract more jobs capital taxable income but also to recycle effectively vast trade surpluses to help counter growing protectionism United States He called on Japan to remove all controls on deposit interest rates soon to remove obstacles to growth offshore market He also should fully deregulate short term money markets develop comprehensive futures markets further open Tokyo Stock Exchange to foreign membership remove fixed rate brokerage commissions Binney also urged Japan to abolish Article Securities Exchange Law like U S Glass Steagall Act separates commercial investment banking At same meeting Goldman Sachs Japan Corp president Eugene Atkinson urged Japan to fully de regulate short term interest rates introduce commercial paper open long term government bond markets to auction system He Japan should allow securities firms to participate foreign exchange business develop over the counter stock options futures Short selling Japanese government cash bonds vital hedging mechanism he added group some Japanese legislators financial leaders Atkinson Binney addressed recently formed to study ways Japan should promote liberalisation financial markets We should leave such matters solely to government bureaucrats Masao Hori Chairman lower house finance committee told group

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT SWISS OPTIONS AND FUTURES
text.author: By Richard Murphy Reuters
text.body: Preparations launch Swiss options futures exchange billed as first completely electronic market kind at advanced stage according to members project team Swiss Options Financial Futures Exchange Soffex new departure introduce additional range financial instruments electronic trading methods to traditionally conservative Swiss market There be no physical exchange floor both trading clearing systems be completely automated new market due to start operating January follows series innovations by bourses Zurich Basle Geneva aimed at preventing loss business face keen competition London Frankfurt These innovations included introduction October continuous trading major shares plans to establish single continuously updated Swiss share index next month to supplement various indices produced by major banks at close business experiments electronic trading Banks themselves year took initiative launching covered warrants on shares other Swiss companies If Switzerland wants to maintain expand international prominence portfolio management our bankers fund managers must same modern instruments at their disposal as their competitors says Soffex president Rudolf Mueller director Union Bank Switzerland computer terminals on business be conducted be confined to Switzerland still unclear how many Swiss based institutions seek membership exchange Formal applications due until next month but preliminary survey completed by Soffex project team week showed strong interest membership The response both Swiss foreign institutions all over country been very encouraging says Philippe Bollag project team Hans Kaufmann who follows Swiss equities Bank Julius Baer says regulated traded options exchange should boost foreign interest Swiss shares possibly increase bourse turnover generally possibility protecting portfolios by hedging should attract Swiss institutional investors Kaufmann added Soffex private company set up by five major Swiss banks bourses Zurich Geneva Basle Trading initially be limited to stock options on to leading Swiss bearer shares options contract on new Swiss share index should follow within six months but trading financial futures be delayed until unspecified future date Options on foreign shares may also be added later Participants be either brokers or dealers operating market through computer terminals their own offices Trading must be conducted exclusively through exchange Exchange membership open to banks traders brokerage firms office Switzerland while Clearing Members must be recognised as banks under Swiss law trading system based on Digital Equipment Corp software hardware provides display best bid offer prices matches orders electronically allows anonymous negotiation block orders maintains members order books interest facility aimed at helping participants to gauge market mood shows number users watching particular instrument at any time Most electronic clearing functions be carried out overnight Each contract cover only five shares instead shares normally traded on existing options futures markets United States London Amsterdam Stockholm reflects fact Swiss shares often cost thousands francs Bearer shares F Hoffman La Roche und Co AG HOFZ Z likely to be on Soffex opening list were quoted week at francs each Contracts initally be offered three end months following trading date plus subsequent January April July or October end months Longer maturities may be added future if market liquidity permits Detailed provisions still to be worked out areas such as margin requirements position limits supervisory regulatory functions exchange brokerage fees Banks polled by Reuters random survey were enthusiastic Soffex but reticent level their own involvement exchange s prospects success We re moving into completely new surroundings require change psychology securities dealer at major Swiss bank We Switzerland used to sitting all day at screen where nobody shouts at you Moving into traded options also require considerable investment equipment staff by participants Completely new dealing back office skills to be acquired some banks already sending staff abroad training

text.title: COCOA LATEST FOCUS FOR COMMODITY PACT NEGOTIATORS
text.author: By Douglas Learmond Reuters
text.body: The credibility government efforts to stabilise fluctuating commodity prices again be put to test over next two weeks as countries try to agree on how buffer stock should operate cocoa market government delegates trade experts Only two weeks ago world coffee prices slumped when International Coffee Organization members failed to agree on how coffee export quotas should be calculated week many same experts gather same building here to try to agree on how cocoa pact reached summer should work still unresolved legal wrangle surrounding International Tin Council ITC buffer stock losses running into hundreds millions sterling also casting shadow over commodity negotiations ITC s failure restricted negotiators ability to compromise as governments do want to be involved pacts built in flaws or unlimited liability but want clear lines drawn between aid trade more hopeful sign cooperation agreement on basic elements new International Natural Rubber Agreement Geneva at weekend Some importing countries insist International Cocoa Organization ICCO buffer stock rules must be muddied quota type subclauses might dictate type cocoa to be bought One consumer country delegate distort support market Trade industry sources blame uncertainty ICCO destabilising market as recent collapse coffee prices made traders acutely aware commodity pacts can founder On Friday uncertainty helped push London cocoa futures down to eight month lows strength sterling also contributed to recent slip prices ICCO daily average prices on Friday fell below must buy level SDRs tonne designated pact came into force at ICCO session January but without rules operation buffer stock Consumers producers could agree on how should operate what discretion should be given agreement limits to trading physical cocoa expressly says cannot operate on futures markets cash balance some dlrs stock almost tonnes cocoa enough to mount large buying or selling operations were carried forward previous agreement Members finance stock through dlrs tonne levy on all cocoa they trade upper limit tonnes key arguments being faced by ICCO working group on buffer stock rules meeting today tomorrow be over non member cocoa differentials buffer stock should pay when trading different types cocoa Another working group scheduled to meet Wednesday to discuss administrative matters full council meets on Thursday Producers so far maintained buffer stock funds should help mop up surplus cocoa produced non member countries such as Malaysia Consumers say when cocoa cheapest buffer stock should buy rather than compete chocolate manufacturers premium priced high quality cocoas argument over buying non member cocoa closely linked to one over differentials different qualities European industry trade advisers suggested as compromise buffer stock maximum share can represent non member cocoa use London futures market s existing differentials different qualities Currently good West African cocoa tendered at par onto London market Discounts currently under review range up to stg tonne Brazilian Malaysian cocoa Consumer delegates same arguments reverse operate when prices high buffer stock should sell highest priced cocoa most demand forcing all prices lower January talks were slowed by split inside European Community key ICCO consumer group France siding producers EC representatives met closed session Brussels on Friday attempt to reach common ground diplomatic source narrowed range positions among nations source EC be looking signs flexibility on part producers next few days be able to respond if they there One ICCO delegate describing producer consumer split consumer proposals mean buying more cocoa less backs concept pact meant to support market where trade buying contrast he producers seem to want to sell their cocoa to buffer stock rather than consumers Other more technical issues still outstanding include whether buffer stock should buy at single announced posted price as previous pact or by announcing buying then accepting offers either case delegates accepted producers must be given clear opportunity to make offers cocoa forward shipment directly to buffer stock way competitive spot offers made by dealers

text.title: PANEL HEAD SAYS MARCOS STILL CONTROLS LARGE FUNDS
text.author: By Chaitanya Kalbag Reuters
text.body: The head Philippine panel charged recovering illegal wealth accumulated by former President Ferdinand Marcos his associates they still controlled large funds circulating country s economy Ramon Diaz Chairman Presidential Commission on Good Government PCGG told Reuters interview There every reason to believe cronies President Marcos his family were able to hide millions millions pesos before they fled As matter fact we been able to get hold crates newly printed currency Diaz did give figures but We believe they still lot funds These funds they use coming elections These funds they used to stage those coups He referring to congressional elections scheduled May to three coup attempts faced by President Corazon Aquino since she toppled Marcos year ago Diaz PCGG so far recovered cash property valued at eight billion pesos sequestered shares stock at least firms We achieved more than what we thought we could achieve one year he added government week announced businessman Antonio Floirendo associate Marcos known as banana king turned over pesos cash to PCGG promised to surrender titles to property New York Hawaii worth another pesos return PCGG lifted freeze sequestration orders on Floirendo s properties Diaz there were already similar preliminary agreements another Marcos associate Roberto Benedicto He Benedicto surrendered control several newspapers radio television stations agreed to PCGG control boards bank hotel he owned Philippines Diaz PCGG based estimates illegal wealth on income tax returns land titles Marcos associates Anything over above reported income s what we to recover he He decision by PCGG week to probe street certificates held by brokers at Manila s two stock exchanges prompted by suspicion illegal funds were circulation Street certificates describe securities held name broker or another nominee instead customer so as to permit easy trading or transfer

reuters.unknown: V f reute u f BC SAUDI OIL MINISTER SE

text.title: SAUDI OIL MINISTER SEES NO NEED TO ALTER PACT
text.author: By Philip Shehadi Reuters
text.body: Saudi Arabian Oil Minister Hisham Nazer OPEC s December agreement to stabilize oil prices at dlrs barrel being implemented satisfactorily there no immediate need to change Nazer interview Reuters television news agency Visnews Saudi Arabia producing around three barrels per day bpd crude oil well below OPEC quota Saudi Arabia world s largest oil exporter continue to restrain production as long as other OPEC members adhere to pact Nazer nation OPEC agreed December to cut production ceiling by pct to bpd abide by fixed prices averaging dlrs barrel February Nazer his first interview since succeeding Ahmed Zaki Yamani October I do foresee any need new measures before th June when our next OPEC meeting take place as scheduled Nazer OPEC producing below bpd all members were abiding by agreements We ve heard news every now then violations but they were at all verified he OPEC production curbs boosted world oil prices year low around eight dlrs barrel August to near dlrs after announcement December pact Spot market prices slipped some two dlrs February but firmed past two weeks to near OPEC levels as traders gained confidence OPEC price output discipline Nazer Saudi Arabia continue to produce below bpd quota if necessary to defend dlr price As long as all OPEC members adhere to program as devised December Saudi Arabia continue to adhere to agreement he Current production three bpd includes oil Neutral Zone shared Kuwait but sales floating storage Nazer King Fahd Saudi Arabia interview Reuters Visnews on March kingdom wanted oil price stability called on non OPEC producers to avoid harmful competition OPEC Saudi Arabia doesn t decide prices by itself but certainly desires price stability he Nazer output level did mean kingdom returned to role swing producer within OPEC Saudi Arabia allowed output to sink as low as two bpd August to compensate slack demand over production by some OPEC states Saudi Arabia playing role being played by OPEC membership as whole because reduction bpd share OPEC market being shared by other members OPEC Nazer Nazer OPEC estimated demand oil during third quarter year be around bpd But he if circumstances changed I am sure then OPEC members consult each other take necessary measures Oil analysts say OPEC pact could come under strain when demand petroleum products generally falls northern hemisphere spring summer Nazer he satisfied extent cooperation non OPEC producers Norway Egypt Soviet Union agreed to help OPEC by restraining production or exports after he visited them on OPEC s behalf earlier year We did ask any country to do anything These were programmes they thought were necessary to stabilise market conditions to help themselves attain better pricing conditions Nazer He up to countries declined to cooperate such as Britain to come up their own proposals if they saw fit

text.title: LEADING INDUSTRIAL NATIONS TO MEET IN APRIL
text.author: By Peter Torday
text.body: Leading industrial nations meet again next month to review their accord on currency stability but U S Officials financial markets convinced now countries live up to commitments to speed up economic growth narrow currency movements recent weeks strongly suggests six leading industrial countries tamed normally unruly financial markets next month s talks seem likely to build on stability Reagan administration official Paris agreement month main reason markets were calm But he interview financial markets also understood That all six countries concluded measures to be taken over period time future should foster stability exchange rates around current levels fact what happened since Paris Monetary analysts stability been helped part by decision industrial nations to bury hatchet cease to quarrel over short term policy objectives Instead they focused on medium term policy goals but left room to adjust their agreements periodic meetings official refused to comment however on whether agreement included secret pact to consider further coordinated interest rate cuts measure industrial nations taken jointly several times past year On February United States Japan West Germany France Britain Canada agreed major currencies were within ranges broadly reflecting underlying economic conditions given commitments by Washington to cut budget deficit by Toyko Bonn to boost economic growth shake up strengthen U S Position future international talks I think these changes strengthen President s hand politically stronger he politically better off we Congress better off we international fora official Administration economic policymaker So be beneficial to continued conduct our initiatives But official also Administration resist calls tax increase to cut budget deficit target Europeans say crucial to help curb economic instability Currency analysts believe Paris agreement set secret short term target ranges their currencies specific agreement to defend those bands intervention According to market sources ranges agreed were to marks to dollar to yen to dollar There no official confirmation specific bands were set although agreement used term ranges first time international economic agreement Paris accord stated six cooperate closely to foster currency stability around current levels week dealers Federal Reserve intervened to stop dollar rising against mark breached to dollar British authorities also understood to intervened to curb sterling s strength International monetary sources say finance ministers central bankers who review market performance their own economic prospects reassemble again Washington just before April policymaking meeting International Monetary Fund sources Italy refused to join Paris pact invited back by Treasury Secretary James Baker Since Paris there signs West German growth slowing while U S Officials they were giving Japan until April to show economic stimulus package offing Signs concern German prospects emerged recently when Bundesbank central bank president Karl Otto Poehl told bankers he consider cutting West German interest rates if Fed ready to follow suit Reagan Administration official show there been some change approach on part central bank Germany But he declined to comment on prospects action by Fed Bundesbank If there such provision private if I talked no longer be private official who asked to be identified Public comments by Fed officials suggest central bank keeping credit conditions broadly unchanged but if major economies continue to show sluggish growth U S Trade deficit remains stubbornly high further coordinated action could be on April agenda

reuters.unknown: A f reute r f BC PHILIPPINES ONGPIN O

text.title: PHILIPPINES ONGPIN OPTIMISTIC ON DEBT TALKS
text.author: By Alan Wheatley Reuters
text.body: Philippines finance minister Jaime Ongpin he cautiously optimistic accord on debt rescheduling be reached commercial bank creditors as he prepared third week talks starting Monday One can never be too optimistic but I m cautiously optimistic we can get agreement We think we re close to deal Ongpin told Reuters by telephone He he received new proposal banks late Friday spent weekend evaluating other members Philippine delegation Ongpin declined to disclose details banks new offer bankers also declined to be specific ahead their next meeting Ongpin on Monday But one senior banker he too guardedly optimistic deal could be struck possibly by end week Still at heart talks Ongpin s offer to pay part country s interest bill Philippine Investment Notes PINs instead cash bank creditors advisory committee led by Manufacturers Hanover Trust Co rejected concept as originally drafted but counter proposal made on Friday contains revised version bankers Manila seeking to reschedule billion dlrs total debt billion wants to pay London Interbank Offered Rate LIBOR cash margin above LIBOR PINs These dollar denominated notes be sold by banks at discount to multi national firms then convert them at face value central bank thus receiving subsidized pesos use funding government approved investments Effectively foreign companies be paying interest margin above LIBOR Philippines conserve foreign exchange enjoy investment inflows reducing marginally need to seek new bank loans But banks rejected PINs proposal original form fearing regulatory accounting problems They were also reluctant to veer principle interest should be paid cash paper fearing other debtor nations emulate idea bankers Ongpin sweetened his original offer by guaranteeing his government redeem notes at pct over LIBOR if there no buyer secondary market week banks came under pressure to accept when senior U S Officials endorsed as fully consistent Treasury Secretary James Baker s debt strategy But banking sources margin over LIBOR still sticking point After Venezuela clinched revised rescheduling agreement month at pct over LIBOR some New York bankers imediately claimed pct should be seen as new benchmark debtor needs no new loans current on interest repaying some principal Philippines meets first two criteria but third

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC TALKING POINT EASTERN

text.title: TALKING POINT EASTERN AIRLINES TEX
text.author: By Matt Spetalnick Reuters
text.body: A rash firings fears mass layoffs management overtures wage concessions set stage all out war between Eastern Airlines unions analysts labor leaders say bitter labor management dispute hurt efforts to revive ailing carrier could ultimately lead Texas Air Eastern s new owner to tranfer scores Eastern jets to non union sister airlines analysts It s trump card Texas Air could resort to if things get bad enough repainting Eastern planes shifting them over Continental Airlines Louis Marckesano analyst Janney Montgomery Scott Inc Philadelphia Eastern lost dlrs analysts see little chance carrier returning to profitability year Since Miami based carrier taken over by Texas Air year morale Eastern s employees plummeted workers labor leaders say Some Eastern officials acknowledge privately morale problems contributed to high absenteeism decline customer service triggering barrage passenger complaints Union leaders accusing Eastern s managers many them newly installed by Texas Air chairman Frank Lorenzo conducting campaign harassment intimidation aimed at ridding airline high paid senior employees It s underhanded way forcing experienced people out attempt to cut company s labor costs Nancy Tauss vice president Transport Workers Union Local Some flight attendants complain they being stalked by what they call spyriders teams auditors they say been hired by Lorenzo to fly on Eastern jets secretly examine flight crew performance Since beginning year at least dozen flight attendants been fired as result such audits some having as little as two dlrs missing liquor sales movie headset rentals Tauss Eastern officials acknowledge management tightening accounting procedures cracking down on absenteeism airline says cost dlrs year highest industry But Eastern spokeman Jim Ashlock denied Miami base airline using unfair labor tactics We re just trying to correct long standing problems causes some dissatisfaction he U S Rep Newt Gingrich Georgia Republican met groups dissident Eastern employees Atlanta reported to told them he may call hearings on airline s labor tactics Labor management long history bitter relations at Eastern Airlines But conflict escalated sharply since January when Eastern president Philip Bakes called reduction dlrs or pct annual labor costs mostly through union concessions Eastern s three principal unions rejected demands wage cuts refused to open their contracts renegotiation Union officials say retaliation their resistance airline launched firing frenzy aimed at intimidating employees squeezing concessions labor During year Texas Air managers assumed control Eastern flight attendants were fired nearly five times greater than union first two months year flight attendants losing their jobs according to union records Other unions report similar losses Texas Air month switch six Eastern s wide body jets to Continental cut rate sister airline Eastern begun hiring other Texas Air carriers to repair planes several cities plans to shut down some maintenance bases according to recent internal memo Texas Air going to write checks to Eastern to underwrite outmoded labor cost structure Bakes told meeting Miami businessmen month He denied however Lorenzo planned to strip Eastern assets

reuters.unknown: F f reute d f BC TECHNOLOGY SCHEDULED FEATURE

text.title: TECHNOLOGY DESKTOP PUBLISHING
text.author: by Catherine Arnst Reuters
text.body: This month s endorsement by International Business Machines Corp IBM two desktop publishing software products should add some much needed standards to one fastest growing segments computer industry analysts say Desktop publishing relatively new market but industry analysts estimate sales reach one billion dlrs year jump to six billion dlrs by fueled by rush corporations to bring their printing publishing needs house rather than to more expensive outside printers Printing big expense most companies Analysts estimate U S corporations spend six to pct their total operating budgets on publishing expenses year At desktop publishing conference Chicago earlier month IBM adopt Adobe Systems Inc s Postscript typesetting language future electronic printing products IBM also support Microsoft Corp s Windows operating environment as graphics interface standard future publishing announcements rather than own Topview environment IBM s announcement give tremendous stimulation to development desktop publishing market David Goodstein president consulting firm Interconsult Inc It gives users permission to go ahead buy products already available without being afraid they be compatible whatever IBM does he advent personal computers laser printers graphics software allowed users to design print brochures newsletters host other communications at their desks fraction cost outside printing firm Analysts credit Apple Computer creating desktop publishing when introduced Macintosh personal computer four years ago easy to use formats excellent graphics capabilities Since then Digital Equipment Corp Xerox Corp Apollo Computer Inc number other vendors identified desktop publishing as major growth area IBM entered market only July when formed Publishing Systems Business Unit IBM s embrace already widely used Postscript language interprets computer commands translates them into instructions printer acknowledgment what already de facto standard Both users makers electronic publishing systems support world s largest computer maker critical to language s ultimate acceptance by users John Warnock president Palo Alto Calif based Adobe Ten pct corporations moved into desktop publishing but pct still sitting back waiting IBM announcement IBM entered licensing pact Adobe Postscript but support Windows quite so broad IBM recognizes Windows as standard but comment on extent commitment to software Windows program integrator allows personal computer users to run number different applications simultaneously

text.title: U S CORPORATE FINANCE BANK PAPER PRESSURED
text.author: By John Picinich Reuters
text.body: Debt securities issued by major U S banks under pressure secondary market as investors shy away paper because Brazil s suspension interest payments month analysts traders On February Brazil suspend interest payments on billion dlrs owed to foreign commercial banks No date established renewal payments Buyers backed away bank paper These securities become very difficult to sell despite rise their yields one corporate bond trader Debt issues major money center banks probably continue to trade off until such time as Brazil situation resolved Loretta Neuhaus vice president Merrill Lynch Capital Markets I told any our investors to stay away banks general she added But I received too many inquiries by prospective buyers lately either Traders debt securities U S banks perceived by investors to be heavily exposed to Latin American debtor nations declined moderately price week They difference between bids offers widened There much trading bank issues these days underwriter referring to wider bid offer spreads However he others pointed out secondary market seen heavy selling by institutions funds other investors The selling been steady over past couple weeks But been far panicky another trader addition institutional sources told Reuters on Friday Salomon Brothers Inc lowered investment ratings on stocks all U S money centers But sources understood action sell recommendation While institutional sources Salomon lowered ratings to M O plus on bank stocks bond traders carried over to secondary market further undermined confidence bank paper banks affected by Salomon s change investment coding were Bank New York Co Inc BK Bankers Trust Co BT Chase Manhattan Corp CMB Chemical New York Corp CHL Citicorp CCI Irving Bank Corp V Manufacturers Hanover Corp MHC J P Morgan Co Inc JPM Marine Midland Banks Inc MM Republic New York Corp RNB Bank Boston Corp BKB First Chicago Corp FNB sources institutional sources Salomon cited filing Securities Exchange Commission by Citibank lead bank Citicorp Citibank Friday told SEC earnings could be reduced by dlrs after tax first quarter dlrs year if to declare billion dlrs medium long term Brazilian loans non performing I believe there be some renegotiation along way between Brazil banks such banks to charge off their loans to Brazil Merrill Lynch s Neuhaus commented But until then investors widely expected to remain leery buying bank paper according to analysts traders unrelated development RJR Nabisco Inc RJR paid what some bond traders amounted to penalty fee when company tapped domestic debt market on Friday RJR Nabisco sold dlrs sinking fund debentures due via lead manager Shearson Lehman Brothers Inc debentures pct coupon were priced at to yield pct or basis points over off the run pct Treasury bonds yield premium over Treasuries greater than similar financing January On January Nabisco sold dlrs same maturity same rated sinking fund debentures priced to yield pct or basis points over pct Treasury bonds Both issues were rated by Moody s by S P Bond traders noted Nabisco called redemption around billion dlrs pct notes Nabisco buy them back at traders The redemption attractive double digit yield issues tainted Nabisco investors eyes one trader Obviously lot prospective buyers believe Nabisco should pay higher yield because Traders also asserted higher yield Friday s pricing reflected total debt issuance one billion dlrs so far year by Nabisco Investors may be showing some signs indigestion remarked one trader Traders they expect Nabisco float more debt coming weeks to finance redemption pct notes Officers on Shearson s syndicate desk declined to comment IDD Information Service day corporate visible supply rose to billion dlrs week billion dlrs previous week

reuters.unknown: A f reute h f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT FRANCE AWAITS ECONOMIC LIFT
text.author: By Brian Childs Reuters
text.body: A year after squeezing to power narrow bare coalition majority Gaullist Prime minister Jacques Chirac swept away cobweb controls regulations choking French economy But France still waiting promised industrial recovery government says follow free market policies Company profits stock market rising But so unemployment Growth stagnant at two pct year outlook inflation held to year low pct uncertain Forced month to cut government s growth target raise inflation estimate Finance Minister Edouard Balladur ruled out action to stimulate economy But some government supporters say they fear time economic miracle may be running out political clock ticking towards Presidential elections due by April next year France s economic performance led by mixed cast right wing ministers socialist President won mixed reviews non partisan analysts Michel Develle Director Economic Studies at newly privatised Banque Paribas government s outstanding achievement been to launch a veritable intellectual revolution breaking staid habits formed by centuries state control The figures may look mediocre neither good nor bad but set their context structural reforms they excellent Develle But some analysts say they fear Balladur chief architect government s free market policies may be pursuing mirage The belief economic liberalism produce explosion economic forces ideological Indosuez chief economist Jean Cheval Personally I think s illusion Dirigisme direction basic fact French system school onwards Ultra liberalism impossible Illusion or government pushed vision hard Over past year foreign exchange consumer price controls been largely abolished labour regulations been pruned to ease sacking redundant workers hugely popular programme been launched to sell state owned banks industries to private investors Since December nearly five French investors bought shares Cie Financiere de Paribas PARI PA glass maker Cie de Saint Gobain SA SGEP PA first two state companies brought to stock market under billion franc five year privatisation plan Encouraged by amnesty past illegal exports capital lifting most currency controls money flooded into Paris stockmarket abroad helping to lift market pct year another pct since December At end year government abolished price controls existed years on services such as car repairs hairdressing freeing state intervention small businesses account some pct French economy immediate result pct rise consumer prices January partly responsible forced revision official inflation forecast to pct two pct or less But even pct be fantastic result when you consider prices now free first time since commented Develle Paribas Other achievements include major reduction state s foreign debts cut state budget deficit to billion francs year billion francs below target down billion But despite healthy balance payments surplus gradual improvement industrial productivity French franc forced by speculators January into humiliating three pct devaluation against West German mark second since Chirac took power recent report by Organisation Economic Cooperation Development pilloried French industry failing to produce goods potential customers wanted Outside mainly state controlled high technology sectors French industrial goods were increasingly ill adapted to demand over priced report French economists including Cheval at Indosuez agreed report One assumptions government if you give them freedom employers invest modernise But nine out ten say yes they like freedom then wait to be told way to go he despite rising industrial investment introduction special incentives to boost youth employment end number jobless reported at record million some more than year earlier problem government there may be little more can do to prod economy into faster growth French producers failed more than most to take advantage year s oil price falls growth hopes now rest on shaky prospects expansion other industrial countries like West Germany Japan they say

text.title: H AND R BLOCK HRB SEES GAINS FROM TAX REFORM
text.author: By Jane Light Reuters
text.body: With April tax return deadline less than month away confused taxpayers be converging on H R Block Inc s offices to interpret new tax codes Financial results nation s largest tax preparer expected to be good fiscal but next year could be bonanza analysts say For short term key word confusion Block Vice President Tom Bloch interview When Congress drastically changes laws confusion results tax preparers benefit Bloch Next year when taxpayers take new forms place them side by side to compare them more people throw their hands up say I m going to get help he Tax forms look very different next year he added Kidder Peabody analyst Herbert Buchbinder expects Block s fiscal year to end April to show good gains over fiscal earnings dlrs or dlrs share on revenues dlrs He estimates Block s fiscal earnings at to dlrs Next year Block could bonanza Buchbinder Based on estimates larger work force Block could show gain more than five pct tax forms prepared he tax season Block prepared U S tax returns up pct over previous year Internal Revenue Service estimates individual income tax returns be filed tax season up year s forms Professional tax preparers accounted just over million forms according to IRS longer term while confusion continue to bring clients into Block s tax preparation offices worldwide there some changes act negative effect Bloch conceded Certain changes filing requirements shorten tax return some cases simplify form he noted addition some low income wage earners be taken off tax rolls he Block currently analyzing price structure to try to offset some negatives tax season average cost each return U S amounted to dlrs dlrs worldwide Bloch tax season rates be up three or four pct line inflation rate he Block expects some expansion tax season electronic filing system directly feeds into IRS can speed up refund process Block can choose where by how much wants to expand into seven cities made available direct filing by IRS Bloch noted IRS estimates returns be directly filed tax season up returns injected tax season First Kansas City analyst Jonathan Braatz Block benefit greatly lower tax rates fiscal Braatz expects Block s advertising budget to be same as year be helped bit by lower costs television ads They may get little more bang their buck he He estimates Block dlrs cash on balance sheet sheet says if interest rates rise could be great benefit to them
