reuters.unknown: F f reute r f BC TRADE NEWS ANALYSIS

text.title: TRADE INTERESTS READY FOR FIGHT IN U S CONGRESS
text.author: By Jacqueline Frank Reuters
text.body: U S lawmakers gearing up showdown between protectionists free traders as major trade bill winds way through committees to vote by full House Representatives late April move to toughen U S enforcement trade laws key House subcommittee week approved toned down version legislation to require President Reagan to retaliate against foreign countries follow unfair trade practices bill be cornerstone congressional efforts to restore competitiveness American industries turn around year s record billion dlrs trade deficit Several lawmakers argued new trade bill made too many concessions to Reagan they intend to back amendments to get tough countries violate trade agreements or keep out U S products On other hand congressmen known their allegiance to free trade bill ties Reagan s hands too much trade disputes they seek to restore his negotiating powers Republican Bill Frenzel Michigan subcommittee s bill one that free trader like me could endorse all respects but he emphasized there consensus among trade lawmakers to work toward bill Reagan Republicans ultimately endorse Frenzel goal trade legislation to make our trade policy stronger without violating our international trade agreements You ll find lot people who think we done former enough You ll find poeple who think we haven t avoided violating agreements key concession made at urging powerful chairman House Ways Means Committee trade subcommittee backed off requirement forced Reagan to automatically impose quotas or tariffs on imports countries engage unfair trade practices also agreed he may waive any retaliation if hurt U S economy Ways Means chairman Dan Rostenkowski Illinois Democrat insisted more moderate approach necessary if House wanted to pass bill Reagan sign into law Reagan year blocked Senate consideration tough House trade bill he branded as protectionist year only reluctantly agreed to support trade bill when he saw Democratic leaders were determined to pass bill As indication his success White House spokesman Marlin Fitzwater told reporters Friday administration still did like some provisions But he added Generally we feel very good bipartisan consideration trade legislation I think we progressing very well first battle take place next week when full House Ways Means Committee considers amendment by Rep Richard Gephardt Missouri Democrat to force countries such as Japan South Korea Taiwan to cut their trade surpluses United States subcommittee limited Gephardt plan to provide only existence large trade surplus United States trigger investigation unfair trade practices but automatically set off retaliation Rep Phil Crane Illinois Republican staunch free trader he try to further weaken Gephardt plan Organized labor pressed lawmakers more relief imports where jobs been lost to foreign competition AFL CIO president Lane Kirkland year angered administration statement any trade bill Reagan sign be worth passage Congress But Rostenkowski set tone trade debate statement I m trying to write legislation to please Lane Kirkland I m trying to write legislation be signed by president writing bill subcommittee rejected calls trade relief specific industries such as textiles Rep Ed Jenkins Democrat Georgia agreed to hold off his fight He intends to push separately bill to protect domestic textile shoe industry aide Reagan vetoed similar measure year House Speaker Jim Wright Texas Democrat one most influential proponents aid specific industries beset by low priced foreign competition Wright Thursday renewed his call import relief domestic oil industry announced his support Senate plan to trigger temporary oil import tariff when imports reach half domestic consumption most part trade bill s provisions toughen U S enforcement trade laws bill forces administration to act rapidly on complaints unfair trade practices such as dumping products United States at prices below cost production also forces administration to act rapidly when industry complains surge imports threatens existence Congressmen change required U S International Trade Commission to impose limits on car imports

text.title: COCOA CONSUMERS NARROW GAP ON BUFFER STOCK ISSUE
text.body: Representatives cocoa consuming countries at International Cocoa Organization ICCO council meeting here edged closer to unified stance on buffer stock rules delegates While consumers do yet common position observer after consumer meeting They much more fluid tone positive European Community consumers were split on question how cocoa buffer stock should be operated when ICCO met January to put new International Cocoa Agreement into effect delegates At January meeting France sided producers on how buffer stock should operate delegates meeting ended without agreement on new buffer stock rules EC Commission met Brussels on Friday to see whether EC cocoa consuming nations could narrow their differences at month s meeting Commissioners came away Friday meeting informal agreement to respond to signs flexibility among producers on key buffer stock issues delegates key issues to be addressed at council session divide ICCO members whether non member cocoa should be eligible buffer stock purchases what price differentials buffer stock should pay different types cocoa delegates consumer delegate producers consumers should be able to compromise on non member cocoa question working group comprising delegates all producing consuming member countries met briefly morning then broke up into producer meeting EC meeting followed by consumer meeting Producers who favour buffer stock buying variety grades cocoa oppose non member cocoa being accepted reviewed their position ahead working group meeting afternoon We waiting to see what consumers say producer delegate We hope they be flexible or be difficult to negotiate ICCO comprises member countries Non members include U S consumer Malaysia increasingly important producer

reuters.unknown: C f reute d f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: SWISS OPTIONS FUTURES EXCHANGE PLANNED FOR
text.author: By Richard Murphy Reuters
text.body: Preparations launch Swiss options futures exchange billed as first completely electronic market kind at advanced stage according to members project team Swiss Options Financial Futures Exchange Soffex new departure introduce additional range financial instruments electronic trading methods to traditionally conservative Swiss market There be no physical exchange floor both trading clearing systems be completely automated new market due to start operating January follows series innovations by bourses Zurich Basle Geneva aimed at preventing loss business face keen competition London Frankfurt These innovations included introduction October continuous trading major shares plans to establish single continuously updated Swiss share index next month to supplement various indices produced by major banks at close business experiments electronic trade Banks themselves year took initiative launching covered warrants on shares other Swiss companies If Switzerland wants to maintain expand international prominence portfolio management our bankers fund managers must same modern instruments at their disposal as their competitors says Soffex president Rudolf Mueller director Union Bank Switzerland computer terminals on business be conducted be confined to Switzerland still unclear how many Swiss based institutions seek membership exchange Formal applications due until next month but preliminary survey completed by Soffex project team week showed strong interest membership The response both Swiss foreign institutions all over country been very encouraging says Philippe Bollag project team Hans Kaufmann who follows Swiss equities Bank Julius Baer says regulated traded options exchange should boost foreign interest Swiss shares possibly increase bourse turnover generally possibility protecting portfolios by hedging should attract Swiss institutional investors Kaufmann added Soffex private company set up by five major Swiss banks bourses Zurich Geneva Basle Trading initially be limited to stock options on to leading Swiss bearer shares options contract on new Swiss share index should follow within six months but trading financial futures be delayed until unspecified future date Options on foreign shares may also be added later Participants be either brokers or dealers operating market through computer terminals their own offices Trading must be conducted exclusively through exchange Exchange membership open to banks traders brokerage firms office Switzerland while clearing members must be recognised as banks under Swiss law trading system based on Digital Equipment Corp software hardware provides display best bid offer prices matches orders electronically allows anonymous negotiation block orders maintains member order books interest facility aimed at helping participants to gauge market mood shows number users watching particular instrument at any time Most electronic clearing functions be carried out overnight Each contract cover only five shares instead shares normally traded on existing options futures markets United States London Amsterdam Stockholm reflects fact Swiss shares often cost thousands francs Bearer shares F Hoffmann La Roche und Co AG likely to be on Soffex opening list were quoted week at francs each Contracts initally be offered three end months following trading date plus subsequent January April July or October end months Longer maturities may be added future if market liquidity permits Detailed provisions still to be worked out areas such as margin requirements position limits supervisory regulatory functions exchange brokerage fees Banks polled by Reuters random survey were enthusiastic Soffex but reticent level their own involvement exchange s prospects success We re moving into completely new surroundings require change psychology securities dealer at major Swiss bank We Switzerland used to sitting all day at screen where nobody shouts at you Moving into traded options also require considerable investment equipment staff by participants Completely new dealing back office skills to be acquired some banks already sending staff abroad training

text.title: U S SOY PRODUCERS THINK EC OILS TAX UNLIKELY
text.body: American soybean producers confident proposed European Community EC tax on vegetable oils fats be rejected but leaving nothing to chance American Soybean Association ASA president elect Wayne Bennett Bennett who leading one three soybean producer delegations on lobbying tour EC capitals speaking at lunch After meetings at Economics Foreign ministries morning he Dutch Government indicated vote against proposal as number other countries Our information suggests we required number votes Brussels to prevent tax proposal going forward he The proposal been talked Brussels past years dropped every time What we want now to kill once all Bennett added Backing up soybean producers active lobbying U S Government also indicated be prepared to retaliate penal import taxes if proposal does get through he U S Government also feels good case to fight proposed tax General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT U S Embassy spokesman U S Exports soybeans products to EC account one fifth annual production worth billion dlrs year Bennett proposed tax on oils fats hit U S Producers badly while at same time virtually doubling price soyoil EC suffer far worse than other higher priced oils because nature proposed tax he added revenue to EC tax simply be used to finance EC s own oilseed subsidy machine he We ASA dedicated free traders We helped defeat Wine Equity Act two years ago but we stand by watch our own farmers suffer such protectionist EC measures Bennett The mood U S turning increasingly protectionist EC s actions fueling chances trade war he added

text.body: A new method calculating Sweden s unemployment figures reduced number jobless by sixth spokesman Central Bureau Statistics SCB reporting substantial drop past year According to revised data there were jobless February representing pct workforce against or pct workforce February SCB official Olle Wessberg new figures were based on more extensive survey unemployed brought Sweden into line practises recommended by Geneva based International Labour Organisation Wessberg new method cut number unemployed by pct The way we now collecting data far more accurate we asking many more questions to find out whether jobless want work whether they able to work whether they actually looked work he told Reuters new method first used January figures showed unemployment dropping to pct workforce pct old style December but Wessberg change apparently been noticed by press Recalculated according to new method unemployment February stood at pct SCB

reuters.unknown: A f reute h f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT EMS MARKS EIGHTH BIRTHDAY
text.author: By Tony Carritt Reuters
text.body: The European Monetary System marks eighth anniversary still vulnerable to turmoil world money markets despite creating island currency rate stability Europe economists say But many economists say system holds eight European Community currencies within narrow fluctuation bands remains infancy new currency European Currency Unit Ecu been runaway success investors borrowers alike seeking alternative to volatile dollar on Wednesday long term vision Ecu as Europe s common currency took step nearer to becoming reality when Belgium minted world s first Ecu coin But economists say members such as West Germany so far blocked second stage development envisaged by system s founding fathers ex West German Chancellor Helmut Schmidt former French President Valery Giscard d Estaing Under phase originally due to started two years after EMS set up decision making to been transferred national governments central banks to autonomous European Monetary Fund But members jealously guarded their sovereignty economic monetary matters The basic problem EMS governments prepared to make quantum leap to situation where certain decisions taken common one economist who closely watched system s development result EC often divided over policy on third currencies accentuating what economists say system s greatest weakness vulnerability to weak dollar Over past months as U S Dollar plunged investors moved into strong currencies resulting sharp rise West German mark severely strained system Another frustration been Britain s failure to lend EMS political support by keeping pound still major world currency outside system No change British government s attitude expected before country s next general elections due by mid Meanwhile system s realignment th since set up prompted European finance ministers to ask EC s highly secretive Monetary Committee Committee Central Bank Governors to come up suggestions reinforcing Their ideas due to be unveiled when finance ministers hold informal meeting Belgium early next month But economists proposals unlikely to involve more than tinkering technical details They sceptical chances any fundamental change Technical measures won t be enough to protect EMS against external factors such as dollar weakness we must take step forward to institutional level Leo de Corel Kredietbank s economic research department Economists say system s fortunes now depend largely on success agreement month among major industrial nations to stabilise exchange rates If dollar resumes slide EMS could be more turbulence they predict

reuters.unknown: V f reute u f AM REAGAN

text.title: IRAN PROBERS AGREE ON IMMUNITY FOR POINDEXTER
text.author: By Michael Posner
text.body: Congressional investigators Iran contra scandal tentatively agreed to grant immunity prosecution to star witness President Reagan s former national security adviser John Poindexter congressional sources today Sources told Reuters chief counsels two special committees probing two year episode darkened White House image plan to take their preliminary accord to court appointed special prosecutor Lawrence Walsh possibly today or tomorrow tentative accord follows weeks negotiating Walsh committee members Poindexter be highest ranking official to be granted immunity investigations arms sales to Iran to gain release hostages held Lebanon clandestine shifting arms profits to arm U S backed rebels Nicaragua at time aid been illegal If agreement reached on Friday by Arthur Liman John Nields chief legal advisors Senate House committees respectively is ratified as expected by Walsh full committees closed door interviews could be held Poindexter two months public testimony days or mid June sources They tentatively reached agreement supposed to meet Walsh or his deputies source told Reuters deliberations by two chief counsels Sources Poindexter could assist investigators determine what Reagan knew diversion funds arms sales to Iran to rebels Nicaragua if anything Reagan denied knowing shift funds although he admitted he gave orders to sell arms through Israel either August or after first shipment September but can t remember when Congress kept dark affair until autumn He be credible witness one source pipe smoking Poindexter Besides Reagan s knowledge or lack another key unanswered questions lingering earlier congressional investigators special presidential review board who received millions dollars clandestine arms profits So far money trail uncovered by probers stops at secret Swiss Cayman Islands bank accounts committees been privately negotiating Walsh over immunity matter prosecutor also called independent counsel been urging committees to hold off on their request at least days Under tentative accord wishes Walsh could be met since public testimony expected before days Poindexter Navy vice admiral along his fired deputy at National Security Council Marine Lt Col Oliver North refused to testify before investigators claiming their fifth amendment rights against self incrimination Yesterday Vice President George Bush television interview he disagreed Maureen court martials but he too disclaimed any details diverted funds So far granting immunity to compel testimony reluctant witnesses been granted to five persons with key figure so far shadowy California international arms merchant Albert Hakim Also getting immunity been North s attractive personal secretary Fawn Hall who to assisted North shredding documents his White House basement office after scandal broke

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC SPAIN TO RELAX EXCHAN

text.title: SPAIN TO RELAX EXCHANGE CONTROLS
text.body: The Bank Spain relaxing exchange controls to help put Spanish banks on equal footing European Community competitors by deadline ending restrictions central bank spokesman The measures to take effect by June were designed to lift restrictions on foreign currency operations line deregulation banking industry he telephone interview spokesman relaxation exchange controls highlighted broader package reforms announced Friday central bank statement measures included increased provisions high risk borrowers provision future pension fund obligations measures were latest steps to deregulate Spain s financial sector move triggered by entry into Community year Spain five years to complete bank deregulation process began when government allowed foreign banks to open branches Since then foreign banks come into market they now control pct system s lending assets Residents Spain can now borrow freely foreign currency up to equivalent billion pesetas against previous ceiling pesetas peseta limit set March Between date end year some dlrs flowed into country on new foreign currency loans central bank spokesman operations over billion pesetas were technically subject to authorisation but be given clearance if government failed to act days Spanish banks also be allowed to expand their foreign currency funding formerly obtainable through deposits by issuing certificates deposit bonds commercial paper They can also employ these funds to invest foreign issues while before they to be converted into deposits Foreign exchange operations can be mixed currencies instead having to borrow lend same currency central bank also lifted restriction on amount foreign exchange loans previously were limited to three times bank s capital equity latest deregulation measures were welcomed by most bankers contrast to rulings issued earlier month imposed pct reserve requirement on new convertible peseta funds held by banks freed short term deposit rates reserve requirement already place on normal peseta deposits intended to curb short term foreign speculative capital entering country threatening government s money supply growth target foreign banker high reserve requirements now account pct deposits placed Spanish banks at disadvantage European competitors government reduced fixed asset investment requirements to pct pct to help offset negative impact interest rate deregulation The real problem freeing interest rates banker This going to take big bite out profits ruling lifted six pct ceiling on interest rates paid on deposits up to days chairman one Spain s leading banks measure expected to bring pct drop profits year

reuters.unknown: F f reute b f BC FDA PANEL BACKS UPJOH

text.title: FDA PANEL BACKS UPJOHN UPJ BALDNESS DRUG
text.body: The federal Food Drug Administration s Dermatologic Drugs Advisory Committee voted unanimously Upjohn Co s Rogaine baldness drug safe effective panel recommended FDA approve Rogaine marketing United States so long as accompanying packaging promotional materials disclose product only limited effect on male pattern baldness five outside experts attending today s FDA committee meeting seemed less concerned Rogaine s safety after outside consultant told them drug appears to be quite safe normal male population consultant Ohio State University Professor Medicine Carl Leier Rogaine s side effects were minimal based on study individuals who been getting drug Canada where approved marketing year The Canadian record quite good one terms side effects Leier experts urged FDA to require warning drug s packaging patients be monitored heart effects while taking drug such as irregular heart beats changes heart rate palpitations fluid retention body Rogaine whose chemical name minoxidil already been approved by FDA when taken orally as high blood pressure drug But Upjohn now seeking agency approval as male baldness treatment when put directly on skin liquid form Upjohn previously claimed when applied to scalp too little Rogaine absorbed into bloodstream to affect heart But panel members concluded amount absorbed merited physician monitoring patients taking drug Under questioning by panel members Upjohn official Richard De Villez acknowledged drug clinical trials produced moderate hair growth on crown head only pct after months He also acknowledged discontinuing treatment make new hair fall out The Upjohn problem they tremendous placebo effect panel member Paul Bergstresser University Texas told meeting He patients administered placebo during clinical trials typically half as much new hair growth as did individuals treated Rogaine As result may take patients eight months before they can tell whether thay benefiting drug he Canada year s treatment costs dlrs U S Upjohn official no price be set drug U S market until approved sale During trials drug found to bizarre side effect on some individuals caused state sexual dysfunction known as exagerrated erection Stewart Ehrreich former FDA official who conducted safety review Rogaine before leaving agency researchers found number cases patients who exagerrated erections as result drug He common effect drugs same class as Rogaine called vaso dilators FDA officials they could make no prediction on when Rogaine might be approved marketing Following vote panel member Dr Robert Stern Boston dermatologist Upjohn statistics exaggerated effect drug He about one five substantial clinical effect he defined as significant growth new hair made patient actually look better He urged insurance companies to cover cost Rogaine treatment order to preserve scarce medical fund resources I hope insurance companies take strong line product we reimburse Stern told reporters I think drug some application some people I think some people find worth expense he But he individuals should be required to pay treatment out their personal funds Stern estimated more than American men already using minoxidil on their scalps outside law by grinding up blood pressure pill dissolving solvent

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC FLOATING RATE NOTE MA

text.title: FLOATING RATE NOTE MARKET STILL IN TURMOIL
text.author: By Dominique Jackson Reuters
text.body: The market floating rate notes showed no clear signs recovery today confusion sent prices tumbling paralysed trading at end week dealers bank officials FRN dealers at least houses did open business many market operators pausing to assess their next steps wake Friday s huge drops panic trading Despite some late signs prices were recovering week today s erratic trade provided similarly mixed final picture longer dated FRNs still clearly under pressure While FRN specialists noted paper on coupons shortly due to be refixed managed to hold up today as notes paying relatively higher margin longer term FRNs were still subject to intense selling pressure Anything longer than years still being sold off seriously as just any paper banking sector one FRN market source at leading U S House He noted one long dated Citicorp issue paper suffered recently on fears over Latin American debt exposure slipped by two points to around FRNs whose coupons refixed regularly usually trade around par U S Canadian bank paper still generally under pressure as Republic Ireland paper due to renewed worries Irish economic situation malaise felt through banking sector two point fall registered by one BNP note to give three point drop over two trading days Retail clients usually seen returning to market as price falls push yield margins up to these attractive levels been unnerved by three days panic dealers Yes there s been some bargain hunting but no one dares to be first to come seriously back one dealer A handful market giants frightened retail away aggressive manipulation As true liquidity drains we going to to see some better market cooperation rationalisation commented one FRN trader now dealing straight bond issues since floater market crisis view shared by majority FRN market sources polled by Reuters since trade began to collapse week or so houses who up until now made market floaters dealers estimated around dozen did quote FRN prices today they reported one or two houses were expected to resume trade securities at all Many called meetings to assess current market situation Given potential volatility market one been conclusively proved by events days senior management now duty bound to revise set parameters within they as market makers now to work commented one senior source at leading U K Investment house However there were no reports formal crisis meeting market makers such as called December year during perpetual FRN market collapse on cards Several firms were expected to cut back drastically on list FRNs traded most volatile paper first to go Elsewhere eurobond market business extremely quiet virtually no activity seen dollar straight sector been becalmed late traders There been no real two way business today neither there been any new issues diversion noted one trader All we seen today some squaring up positions she added Investors remain cautious dollar though recently stable still potential downside risk Eurosterling market sector aside FRNs been headlines lately quiet today ahead U K Government budget due to be announced tomorrow Undertone very firm dealers expecting positive fiscal package tomorrow if more good economic news to boost sterling at least confirmation bull factors bolstered eurosterling gilt edged bonds lately It just sit wait today but I expect be full steam ahead on Wednesday commented one sterling market source Prices showed gains to to point across board Dealers several new eurosterling issues were currently pipeline early issue expected to be major European bank currently mandate market other sectors euroyen also maintained firm tone Although market expected to be resting until trading switches to April value date euroyen sector expected to be buoyed by some professional switching out Japanese government bonds into relatively cheaper euroyen bonds Two new yen issues were features on otherwise quiet primary market Both billion yen due first Eksportfinans at five pct pct led by Mitsubishi Finance International second Export Development Corp at pct pct led by Bank Tokyo International day s only other feature targetted dlr stepped coupon deal Kawasaki Steel due

reuters.unknown: RM Y A f reute u f BC NORWAY APPROVES TRADE

text.title: NORWAY APPROVES TRADE BAN AGAINST SOUTH AFRICA
text.body: Norway s parliament approved extensive trade ban against South Africa but left shipowners key loophole through controversial oil shipments on Norwegian tankers may continue government officials unilateral boycott proposed by Norway s minority Labour government gives domestic companies until late September to cut remaining trade ties South Africa Namibia The legislation discussed today must be seen as isolated measure but as step international process Norway s foreign minister Thorvald Stoltenberg told parliament Government officials they hope move intensify international pressure against Pretoria regime s apartheid policies Sweden similar move week promised to halt all trade South Africa by October Norway s boycott although forbidding crude oil shipments to South Africa on Norwegian owned tankers makes important exception ships whose final destination decided while they at sea Oil cargoes often resold by trades after loading making difficult shipowners to know their ships final port at start voyage Critics bill leaves door open continued oil shipments to South Africa They called stricter sanctions to stop all Norwegian shipping to South Africa Norwegian tankers supplied South Africa pct crude imports during early s but trade dropped sharply to just one cargo three months trade ministry officials latest trade figures show Norwegian imports South Africa dropped pct to crowns during first eight months while exports plunged pct to crowns year ago figure Many say law already effect because dramatic drop trade between South African Norway Foreign Ministry spokesman Per Paust told Reuters Norwegian business at early stage started restructuring relations South Africa anticipation law No one boycott profound effect on international trade South Africa but important political statement by Norwegian government he Oslo government review effects ban on Norwegian industry after two years may propose amendments if industry can show hurt by law Norwegian imports South Africa limited mainly to high grade manganese coppernickle ores used ferro alloys light metals industries Metals manufacturers estimate some jobs could be affected by boycott suitable replacements these ores found legislation now goes on to upper house formal ratification later week parliamentarians

reuters.unknown: C G T M f reute d f BC TRADE INTERESTS READY

text.title: TRADE INTERESTS READY FOR BATTLE IN U S HOUSE
text.author: By Jacqueline Frank Reuters
text.body: U S lawmakers gearing up showdown between protectionists free traders as major trade bill winds way through committees to vote by full House Representatives late April move to toughen U S enforcement trade laws key House subcommittee week approved toned down version legislation to require President Reagan to retaliate against foreign countries follow unfair trade practices bill be cornerstone congressional efforts to restore competitiveness American industries turn around year s record billion dlrs trade deficit Generally bill s provisions toughen U S enforcement trade laws trade bill forces administration to act rapidly on complaints unfair trade practices such as dumping products United States at prices below cost production also forces administration to act rapidly when industry complains surge imports threatens existence writing bill subcommittee rejected calls trade relief specific industries such as textiles Several lawmakers argued new trade bill made too many concessions to Reagan they intend to back amendments to get tough countries violate trade agreements or keep out U S products But congressmen known their allegiance to free trade bill ties Reagan s hands too much trade disputes they seek to restore his negotiating powers Bill Frenzel R MI subcommittee s bill one that free trader like me could endorse all respects but he emphasized there consensus among lawmakers to work toward bill Reagan Republicans ultimately endorse goal trade legislation to make our trade policy stronger without violating our international trade agreements he key concession made at urging Ways Means Committee chairman Dan Rostenkowski D IL trade subcommittee backed off requirement forced Reagan to impose automatically quotas or tariffs on imports countries engage unfair trade practices also agreed president may waive any retaliation if hurt U S economy Rostenkowski insisted more moderate approach necessary if House wanted to pass bill Reagan sign into law Reagan year blocked Senate consideration tough House trade bill he branded as protectionist year he only reluctantly agreed to support trade bill when he saw Democratic leaders were determined to pass such legislation White House spokesman Marlin Fitzwater told reporters late week administration still did like some bill s provisions but he added Generally we feel very good bipartisan consideration trade legislation I think we progressing very well first battle take place next week when full House Ways Means Committee considers amendment by Rep Richard Gephardt D MO to force countries like Japan South Korea Taiwan to cut their trade surpluses U S subcommittee limited Gephardt plan to provide only existence large trade surplus United States trigger investigation unfair trade practices but automatically set off retaliation Organized labor pressed lawmakers more relief imports where jobs been lost to foreign competition AFL CIO president Lane Kirkland year angered administration when he any trade bill Reagan sign be worth passage Congress But Rostenkowski set tone trade debate by saying I m trying to write legislation to please Lane Kirkland I m trying to write legislation be signed by president Rep Ed Jenkins D GA intends to push separately bill to protect domestic textile shoe industry aide Reagan vetoed similar measure year House Speaker Jim Wright Texas one most influential proponents aid specific industries beset by low priced foreign competition week renewed his call import relief domestic oil industry announced his support Senate plan to trigger temporary oil import tariff when imports reach half domestic consumption

fall world coffee prices sharply reduced country s foreign exchange earnings Adebayo Adedeji executive secretary U N Economic Commission Africa told meeting there increasing net outflow resources reuters.unknown: F f reute r f BC ATT T MAY FACE STRU

text.title: ATT T MAY FACE STRUGGLE OVER DEREGULATION
text.author: By David Brough Reuters
text.body: American Telephone Telegraph Co may hard time convincing U S regulatory authorities lifting controls on long distance business benefit consumers industry congressional analysts say There s clearly going to to be effort by ATT to say deregulation adverse effect on consumer Gerry Salemme policy analyst House telecommunications consumer protection finance subcommittee Salemme if Federal Communications Commission eased restrictions on ATT Congress probably consider taking legislative oversight action to protect consumers interests ATT pct interstate long distance market asked FCC to cut back price rate regulations control long distance phone business ATT spun off local telephone services operations into seven regional Bell companies as part court ordered breakup telephone giant regional companies been prohibited manufacturing equipment offering information services out of region long distance service But some them want to move into those areas particularly provision long distance services compete directly ATT ATT s request came response to FCC notice issued January proposed to streamline regulation certain parts long distance business FCC closely examine potential effects proposal on consumers FCC spokeswoman Mary Beth Hess That be foremost our mind Hess Hess she expected FCC to respond few months Congressional aides they were concerned if regulation reduced ATT use dominant market position to raise consumer rates Consumer groups say ATT s concern business clients most lucrative market underscores danger without full regulation FCC any increased costs be passed onto consumer rather than big business ATT however says deregulation benefit consumers company become more competitive because to wait FCC authorization before introducing new services spokeswoman Edith Herman However Gene Kimmelman Consumer Federation America represents more than consumer groups nationally When ATT offers new services they tend to be geared toward high volume business market rather than average consumer ATT proposed addition to lifting profit regulation FCC allow new rates to go into effect days instead current days company also called reduction amount documentation must file FCC each time introduces or changes long distance services With filing we re suggesting regulators replace blanket approach to regulating ATT more finely tuned targeted approach Lawrence Garfinkel AT T s vice president marketing services statement We believe by using scalpel instead meat axe public interest can be protected all consumers benefit he added MCI Communications Corp also asked FCC to ease restrictions on ATT saying encourage competition Some industry analysts MCI proposal effort to halt FCC mandated price cuts forced ATT rivals to cut prices eroding profits industry MCI lost dlrs on sales billion dlrs year analysts proposal benefit MCI because ATT no longer impose price cuts MCI to follow when costs fell industry I m sort mystified by those comments retorted Herman district manager ATT ATT if deregulated no intention passing on cost reductions she added Kimmelman legislative director Consumer Federation he opposed deregulation because left no alternatives ensure against overcharging by ATT He FCC past instructed ATT to reduce prices when company benefitting lower costs increased use by consumers long distance services Without full regulatory authority may no longer happen he added

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC BOESKY

text.title: SEC OKAYS BOESKY FIRMS MOVE TO PROTECT FUNDS
text.body: The Securities Exchange Commission approved request by two firms controlled by inside trader Ivan Boesky allows them to take steps to protect hundreds millions dollars potential claimants SEC granted requests made by Seemala Partners L P IFB Managing Partnership L P to withdraw as registered brokers effective March action partnerships no longer subject to SEC s net capital rules requiring them to remain solvent as brokerage firms Seemala argued move be necessary if noteholders Ivan Boesky Co L P to be repaid asking SEC to speed withdrawal as registered broker Seemala wold repay to Boesky Co also controlled by former Wall Street arbitrageur dlrs subordinated debt plus accrued interest IFB Managing Partners also given approval to withdraw as broker no significant assets SEC Once repaid Boesky Co pay dlrs senior participating notes dlrs subordinated participating notes Hudson Funding Corp to certain noteholders Seemala told SEC Under planned repayment scheme Seemala told SEC noteholders forgo claims prepayment penalties some additional interest amounting to more than dlrs plan be public interest Seemala argued since noteholders many savings loan institutions insurance companies receive repayment principal on their notes Seemala also argued plan help limited partners Boesky Co who were charged Boesky insider trading scandal by protecting remaining equity noteholders claims Unless Boesky firms allowed to complete repayment plan Seemala Boesky Co noteholders seek total claims dlrs plus dlrs to dlrs month addition addition to other claims Such claims could wipe out Boesky Co s assets before other creditors can establish their claims Seemala only opposition to Seemala s Feb request to withdraw as broker came Berger Montague P C counsel plaintiffs class action suit against Seemala other defendants suit involves charges stemming Boesky s insider trading stock several major companies Berger Montague told SEC opposes Seemala proposal because allow Boesky Co noteholders to settle their claims ahead plaintiffs class action because Seemala did disclose total amount claims against what percentage defrauded investors get Seemala repayment scheme leave pool dlrs free claims Boesky Co noteholders could satisfy other claimants pool be addition to funds placed escrow under insider trading settlement agreements including dlrs Dennis Levine dlrs Boesky approving request SEC barred Seemala Boesky Co making any distributions to limited partners one year required limited partners who receive distributions to agree to make themselves liabile up to point any case filed partnerships SEC also required Seemala Boesky Co to get confirmation their assets nationally recognized accounting firm agency Boesky Co existing potential claimants against similar interests eliminating major creditors preserving assets future claims

text.title: ICCO TO EXAMINE BUFFER STOCK PROPOSAL TOMORRROW
text.body: The International Cocoa Organization ICCO council adjourned after presenting divergent producer consumer views on buffer stock rules agreeing to examine draft compromise proposal on buffer stock issue tomorrow delegates ICCO Executive Director Kobena Erbynn draw up what some delegates called pre compromise present to buffer stock working group at hrs GMT Tuesday they While consumer producer member nations disagree how buffer stock should be implemented both sides reiterated they were willing to compromise to come to agreement they I am optimistic we be able to come to agreement maybe tomorrow or next day but some time later session consumer delegate Producers say they want buffer stock to consist only ICCO member cocoa comprise representative basket various grade cocoas pay different prices different grades delegates Some consumers rather buffer stock manager be able to buy non member cocoa also pay single price buffer stock cocoa without respect to origin Consumer members were unified their views on how buffer stock should operate several countries backing different aspects producer stance delegates semi annual council meeting scheduled to run until March Consideration buffer stock rules most controversial topic on agenda delegates

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC SAUDI BUSINESSMEN SEE

text.title: SAUDI BUSINESSMEN SEEK TO BOOST PRIVATE SECTOR
text.author: By Stephen Jukes Reuters
text.body: Top Saudi businessmen discussing ways to bolster kingdom s private sector at Chamber Commerce conference here today called finance to be made available more easily industrial projects Saleh Kamel leading businessman head Jeddah based Dallah group business needed more funding welcomed recent measures to encourage banks to step up lending But yesterday conference participants were publicly reprimanded investing enough kingdom Prince Khaled al Faisal governor Asir region hosting four day conference accused businessmen showing ingratitude at time when government been prepared to draw heavily on reserves to maintain spending stimulate economy Businessmen their part argued today kingdom s commercial banks were unwilling to take risks help finance industrial projects Saleh Kamel one Saudi Arabia s leading businessmen head Jeddah based Dallah group told Reuters general economic outlook trade industry improved We can be optimistic economy looking brighter he But he also businessmen needed more finance welcomed measures being taken to encourage banks to step up lending committee at Saudi Arabian Monetary Agency kingdom s central bank now examining problem Commercial banks fact extremely liquid but become highly selective extending new credit after many companies ran into trouble repaying debt during three years Between banks to make risk provisions totalling billion riyals results now coming show another year when heavy reserves to be made against bad doubtful loans effects Middle East economic downturn hit construction sector Saudi Arabia very hard there been sharp fall development lending new industrial projects Saudi Industrial Development Fund major source private sector finance made loan commitments totalling riyals financial year to September decline nearly pct on previous year government credit agency specialises low cost loans development funding pct project s total value pattern agency s lending also shown distinct shift away infrastructre related industry such as cement plants to capital intensive projects Businessmen opportunities now available service industries tourism slowly developing Gulf region But new investment manufacturing industry shows fewer signs taking hold

reuters.unknown: RM F A f reute u f BC U S MONEY MANAGERS

text.title: U S MONEY MANAGERS MAY LEAN TO STOCKS VS BONDS
text.author: By Martin Cherrin Reuters
text.body: U S money managers investment advisors they expect stocks to continue to outperform bonds but some hedging bets by keeping roughly half portfolios bonds cash quick investment shifts Merrill Lynch new asset mix report due today urge weightings pct stock pct bonds pct cash versus pct bonds pct stock pct cash previously We believe overweighting stocks warranted because positive momentum corporate earnings Christine Lisec Tinto Merrill senior investment strategist Lisec Tinto who formulated Merrill s latest asset mix recommendations new chief investment strategist Charles Clough there may be some consolidation recent stock price gains but market appears to good potential Through Friday stock prices as measured by Dow Jones Industrial Average surged pct Meanwhile Shearson Lehman Treasury bond price index edged up pct We believe equity market much more upside potential than bond market Chrysler Corp C treasurer Fred Zuckerman He interest rates coming down I bet lot they come down sharply Chrysler s billion pension fund week sold dlrs corporate bonds first two planned sales slightly less than one billion dlrs corporates Zuckerman told Reuters proceeds be used to buy stock to bring equities to pct or more portfolio roughly even bond stock portfolio split also urged by Wright Investors Service billion dlrs under management but more optimistic on bonds than stocks We d put half bonds half equities now Judith Corchard Wright senior vice president She bond share lifted pct three months The stock market appreciated sharply discounted future corporate earnings extensively Corchard She we re worried stock price correction as much as to pct within six or possibly even three months Meanwhile Wright expects bonds to benefit half to one percentage point decline interest rates by year s end At level stock market there more advantage to being long term bonds than equities given our interest rate scenario Corchard The stock market come long way short time I d be hardpressed to jump into stocks Dow near unless I really convinced earnings multiples increase fixed income securities portfolio manager at major money center bank He bank kept bond equity portfolio mix fairly stable recently probably make no major changes months as awaits economic oil price dollar trends We ve seen no real movement bonds to stocks among our funds George Collins president T Rowe Price Associates billion dlrs assets under management While he detected no rush into stocks bonds either among many mutual funds under T Rowe Price umbrella or among outside money managers Collins thinks stocks better investments than bonds at time In near term stock market more prospects growth due to mixed signals on economy so far slim chance Federal Reserve ease policy still heavy debt accumulation Collins He expects U S stocks to improve further because there more corporate earnings potential nominal interest rates already low there strong foreign demand stock Collins funds include bonds stocks firm long maintained aggressive pct weighting equity rest bonds cash Our equity managers taken slightly heavier cash position equity portfolios lately Collins Cash portfolios usually means short Treasury bills can be readily sold to allow rapid investment shifts Many portfolio managers working relatively high cash positions equity accounts often to pct given belief there may well be downward price corrections enroute to higher ground bond portfolios money managers generally showed preference shorter term years under Treasury notes to lesser extent agency securities rather than longer dated Treasury issues corporate bonds Since yield premiums corporate over Treasury bonds now lowest years many investors believe corporates overvalued versus Treasury agency issues Another negative cited corporate bonds risk hostile takeovers leveraged buyouts sudden ratings declines does exist Treasury or Federal agency securities Farm Credit paper cited by some as undervalued good buy despite issuer s well publicized financial woes

text.title: EC WARNS U S AND JAPAN ON TRADE TENSIONS
text.author: By Paul Mylrea Reuters
text.body: The European Community EC delivered warnings to both Japan United States over trade frictions hit relations between Community main trading partners EC foreign ministers meeting here issued statement deploring Japan s continued trade imbalance appealed greater effort by country to open markets Ministers also issued statement saying they were disturbed by moves U S to limit imports textiles warned Community react to any such moves EC External Trade Commissioner Willy De Clercq already written to his U S counterpart special U S Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter outlining EC s concerns ministers they were very disturbed by U S moves adding the adoption such measures fail to negative effect on process multilateral negotiations just started as well as on bilateral relations Any unilateral U S moves leave EC no option but to react according to laws world trade body General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT they separate statement on Japan EC ministers they deplore continued aggravation imbalance trade and expect Japan to open up market more statement added EC continued to insist Japanese government must boost imports stimulate demand Ministers also called on European Commission to prepare report on U S Japanese trade July year to enable them to take action where necessary One diplomat call report showed ministers were determined to let Japanese question drop It wil be back on table again again diplomat De Clercq told journalists There certain nervousness growing impatience within Community on trade relations Japan But diplomats Community keen to continue talking Tokyo to try solve problem rather than embark on costly damaging trade war

text.title: DEBT PROGNOSIS AGREED BUT NO CURE IN SIGHT
text.body: Latin America urgently needs more money if to grow way out deepening debt crisis but fresh ideas how to stimulate new lending quickly seem to be short supply Bankers officials academics at conference organized by Massachusetts Institute Technology stressed importance proper economic policies increased private investment But they offered no glimpse grand design to banish specter widespread repudiation region s billion dlr debt Such solution still sight Nobel Prize winning economist Franco Modigliani conference held against background recent suspension interest payments by Brazil Ecuador but Argentine finance secretary Mario Brodersohn who spelled out most clearly social economic strains caused by need to service billions dlrs debt Brodersohn who negotiating currently foreign banks billion dlr loan says Argentina to grow at four pct annual rate between now simply to restore per capita income to level He investment needed to fuel growth can come partly structural economic reforms at home but alone be enough We to reduce transfer resources Brodersohn adding mounting economic strains Latin America make matter urgency Brodersohn other Latin officials however did spell out how should be achieved creditors strategy spelled out by U S Treasury Secretary James Baker October to spur additional lending by private banks multilateral development banks return economic reforms But there widespread recognition at conference Baker Plan fallen well short expectations Miguel Urrutia senior official Inter American Development Bank instance IADB lending actually declined started slowly Mexico due to sign billion dlr loan on Friday be first major facility under Baker Plan called net new bank lending between target Morris Goldstein International Monetary Fund now optimistic Deputy Assistant Secretary State Inter American Affairs Paul Taylor acknowledged Baker Plan has yet succeeded as well as we hoped But if debtors at conference were hoping to hear official commitment to try new tack they must been disappoiunted Ted Truman director International Finance Diviision at Federal Reserve Board banks were short sighted lending promptly amounts called by Baker He some streamlining lending process may be needed but added I see no alterantive to present course responsible cooperation major theme at conference however world economy might continue to cooperate while debtors creditors muddle along If export markets dry up because recession or protectionism speakers warned Latin America be even more hard pressed to service debts Rimmer de Vries chief international economist at Morgan Guaranty Trust Co he very concerned world economic growth three to pct cannot be sustained West Germany Japan wowuld take up slack world economy arise as U S narrows trade deficit There s deflationary force coming down mountain I don t know who s going to be rolled over de Vries He called new lending initiative wide menu options as alternatives to pure new money Can we manage lending bit more imaginatively he asked conference But new ideas take time to devise implement Brazil s suspension interest payments shows aptience debtors might be wearing thin Persio Arida former director Brazizlian central bank who key architect country s Cruzado plan to curb inflation there incentive problem throughout Latin America

text.body: Strikes against government freeze on wages spread to most regions Yugoslavia week official news agency Tanjug night thousands workers were involved officials feared more strikes were on way At least strikes taken place around Yugoslavia past two weeks but most those previously reported were northern republic Croatia Prime Minister Branko Mikulic imposed wage freeze month effort to curb rampant inflation now running at annual rate almost pct government froze wages at their level fourth quarter any future rises must be linked to productivity measure met widespread disapproval Even some senior executives major industrial enterprises criticised freeze interviews Tanjug agency strikes took place week southern republic Montenegro predominantly ethnic Albanian province Kosovo central republic Bosnia Hercegovina workers struck while many teachers Belgrade refused to take their paychecks Earlier Yugoslav journalists who asked to remain anonymous told Reuters they been barred strike hit factories They they been told they could enter without permits whereas before strikes no permits been necessary to visit factories

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT SAUDI CORPORATE DEBT
text.author: By Stephen Jukes Reuters
text.body: Bankers Saudi Arabia negotiating delicate balance between western business practice oriental justice as they try to restructure troubled corporate sector s debt problem lies reconciling Saudi Arabia s western style banking system Islamic Sharia legal system interest payments may be viewed as usury illegal So Saudi Arabia s commercial banks pinned hopes on negotiated settlements rather than enforced ones resigned to being able to recoup loans full they become highly selective over enterprises eligible new credit after run failures forced heavy loan loss provisions ate relentlessly into profits As result they attracted complaints business community says starved funds while government criticising playing larger role economy private sector s downturn began earnest as oil prices slid some companies were slow to react businessmen Bloated inventories some cases poor management created problems Some also blamed government paying public sector contracts promptly Long negotiations to reschedule some debt now producing results One banker Banks agreeing reschedulings but often at high price They resigned to fact full recovery of loans always possible few cases private sector firms been stripped assets during or prior to debt renegotiations leaving banks virtually no hope repayment full first major rescheduling sealed until mid February year when Arabian Auto Agency known as AAA reached agreement to stretch out repayments riyals debt to some Saudi international banks Bankers deal Jeddah based heavy equipment importer likely to set precedent private sector greeted relief after months negotiations AAA s rescheduling been followed few days by draft accord on billion riyal debt one Kingdom s most publicised companies Saudi Research Development Corp REDEC These two cases raised hopes other companies also reach agreement soon Bankers cement importer Arabian Bulk Trade construction trading firm Ali Fahd Shobokshi Group still negotiating creditor banks They increasingly resigned to there being little legal recourse Saudi Arabia rescheduling payments geared to company s cash flow often very low only way to recover at least portion outstanding loans Though bankers feel they generally tacit backing Saudi Arabian Monetary Agency SAMA Kingdom s central bank some say should take more active role However bankers encouraging SAMA blocked black list borrowers banks drawn up circulated over year Bankers AAA accord negotiated by committee led by Saudi British Bank likely model banks insisted on full repayment all obligations Sixty pct debt be repaid monthly instalments over seven years at point over Bahrain interbank offered rates BIBOR remaining pct only to be paid after completion first tranche also at over BIBOR accrued interest on pct be waived as long as first tranche met full As one banker put Many banks took view better to get some money back rather than none at all

text.author: By Rie Sagawa Reuters
text.body: Underlying dollar sentiment bearish operators may push currency to new low unless Japan takes steps to stimulate economy as pledged Paris accord foreign exchange analysts polled by Reuters here The dollar expected to try psychological barrier yen to fall even below level senior dealer at one leading bank dollar eased week but remains stable at around yen Six major industrial countries agreed at meeting Paris February to foster currency stability Some dealers dollar may decline long term but drastic fall unlikely because U S Fears renewed inflation fears reduced Japanese purchases U S Treasury securities needed to finance U S Deficit Dealers generally doubted whether any economic package Japan could adopt soon be effective enough to reduce trade surplus significantly such measures probably invite further U S Steps to weaken dollar Under Paris accord Tokyo promised package measures after fiscal budget passed to boost domestic demand increase imports cut trade surplus But debate on budget been delayed by opposition boycott Parliamentary business over proposed imposition five pct sales tax government only slim chance producing meaningful economic package near future dealers If no such steps taken protectionist sentiment U S Congress grow putting greater downward pressure on dollar they factors affecting U S Currency changed since before Paris accord they added Underlying sentiment dollar remains bearish due to still sluggish U S Economic outlook international debt crisis triggered by Brazil s unilateral suspension interest payments on foreign debts reduced clout Reagan administration as result Iran Contra arms scandal senior dealer at leading trust bank There possibility dollar may decline to around yen by end year Chemical Bank Tokyo branch vice president Yukuo Takahashi But operators find hard to push dollar either way fear possible concerted central bank intervention Dealers there were widespread rumours U S Federal Reserve telephoned some banks New York to ask quotes Wednesday even intervened to sell dollar when rose to marks Bank England also apparently sold sterling London when neared dlrs on Wednesday they But other dealers they doubted efficacy central bank intervention saying may stimulate dollar s decline because many dealers likely to await such dollar buying intervention as chance to sell dollars However First National Bank Chicago Tokyo Branch assistant manager Hiroshi Mochizuki The dollar show drastic movement at least to end March Other dealers U S Seems unwilling to see any strong dollar swing until Japanese reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC ECONOMISTS SEE SLUGGI

text.title: ECONOMISTS SEE SLUGGISH JAPANESE ECONOMY AHEAD
text.author: By Kunio Inoue Reuters
text.body: The Japanese economy remain sluggish months ahead after turning worst performance years private economists Consumer spending main driving force domestic demand likely to remain lacklustre although brisk housing business investment help sustain economy year economists They they were shocked by Economic Planning Agency report today private spending fell pct Oct Dec quarter first time years report Japan s gross national product rose real pct Oct Dec after revised pct increase previous quarter GNP growth real pct down pct Agency officials worst performance since when GNP contracted pct wake first oil crisis They expressed concern pct decline consumer spending final quarter but only temporary as exceptionally warm winter weather depressed retail sales But most private economists disagreed consumers were likely to remain pessimistic coming months as they saw their real income level off Sure consumers may spent less on winter clothes or heating apparatus because warm winter year but they done so because they become even more uneasy their future pay rises Shoji Saito general manager Mitsui Bank s economic research division He outlook pay increases gloomy because falling employment many industries particularly those hit hard by yen s rise Masao Suzaki senior economist at Bank Tokyo weakened consumer confidence most worrying factor Without brisk consumer spending Japan can hardly achieve domestically generated economic growth as government put lid on fiscal measures he Other economists pct growth registered Oct Dec may been inflated by special factors including exceptionally heavy spending public sector Johsen Takahashi chief economist at Mitsubishi Research Institute pct increase public sector spending Oct Dec resulted issue gold coins This just one shot spending we can t expect high level public sector consumption following quarter Takahashi Agency officials public spending risen pct Oct Dec without issue marked years Emperor Hirohito s reign Takahashi economy might contract current quarter given lack additional significant government spending sluggish consumer spending Saito most effective government action be income tax cuts postponement beyond next January proposed controversial sales tax

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute r f BC AM BANK

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT U S BANKING REGULATION
text.author: By Kenneth Barry Reuters
text.body: U S banks under pressure to meet vigorous competition but Congress continues to duck hard choices on banking law reform could benefit consumers Supporters say deregulating banking increase competition offer consumers more choices bring lower fees financial services home mortgage interest rates But Senate Banking Committee week put off until later year decisions on pressing issues such as whether banks could enter new businesses like underwriting corporate debt selling insurance real estate committee also reined banks competitors so called nonbank banks elude technical definition bank because they do both accept deposits make loans committee meeting room became battleground giants financial industry banks brokerages insurance firms retail industrial corporations but little consideration given to consumer lobbies backed various amendments to protect their turf bill rescues federal deposit insurance fund thrift institutions puts moratorium on any changes banking law passed sent on to full Senate House Representatives yet to act Behind political deals larger question whether Congress end or modify half century old separation commercial investment banking or leave alone One argument support change fees financial services come down if Congress expands banks powers Lower fees to underwrite mortgage backed securities example could lead to lower interest rates on home mortgages supporters say A lot nonbanking firms used loopholes to get into banking but banks be allowed into any new businesses says Robert Litan Brookings Institution We been seeing gigantic turf war says Litan who favors new powers banks if deposits safeguarded swirl corporate mergers financial information explosion blurred distinction between activities banks security brokerages On wider horizon U S financial institutions face stepped up competition financial centers like London Tokyo international transactions West German Japanese banking more concentrated few large banks while most European countries allow banking securities to be mixed All these forces put pressure on U S financial firms to adapt to change but congressional debate over reform drags on committee s bill put freeze on any changes chairman Senator William Proxmire promised to return issues October If approved by Congress bill postpone applications before Federal Reserve new powers to three largest banks Citicorp J P Morgan Bankers Trust Other industries where regulatory barriers fallen experienced lower fees emergence new players accelerated innovation But these advances airlines trucking telecommunications been without drawbacks Companies were slow to adapt disappeared under new competitive regime while public faced bewildering number new choices Reagan administration favors bank reform traditional method companies use to raise funds borrowing banks given way to selling corporate debt other new securities off limits to banks But critics say soundness banking system created by such laws as Glass Steagall Act be undermined Banks treated as special shielded marketplace s vagaries by Federal Deposit Insurance Corp Federal Savings Loan Insurance Corp FSLIC performs same function thrifts one issue committee did act on benefits consumers new funding federal insurance fund deposits at savings loan associations fallen to lowest ratio reserves to deposits history Despite efforts toward change Congress ban on interstate banking remains barriers crumbling anyway because state legislatures agreeing to permit bank mergers across state lines within region Congress proceeding cautiously having mind banking industry s tribulations early s But some say moving too cautiously banks to keep pace what happening business here around world

text.title: GUYANA PRESIDENT CALLS POISON SCARE MISCHIEVOUS
text.body: President Desmond Hoyte recent reports widespread thallium sulphate poisoning Guyana were mischievous gravely damaged country s food exports There no thallium sulphate poisoning epidemic Guyana as been rumored Hoyte radio address late Sunday Reports spate poisonings chemical led some newspapers Caribbean to call ban on food exports Guyana Trinidad Tobago restricted imports Guyanese rice Hoyte Thallium sulphate banned many countries blacklisted since by World Health Organization as deadly chemical been used by Guyana s state sugar corporation as rodent poison Calling reports mischievous invention Hoyte tests shown some Guyana s main exports such as wheat flour were contaminated Hoyte based his statements on tests conducted by WHO Pan American Health Organization found only seven cases thallium sulphate poisoning thus far

text.title: EC WARNS U S AND JAPAN ON TRADE TENSIONS
text.body: The European Community EC yesterday warned Japan United States main trading partners friction over trade issues affecting EC s relations both countries EC foreign ministers issued statement deploring Japan s continued trade imbalance appealed country to make greater effort to open up markets They also they were disturbed by draft bill before U S Congress impose permanent quotas on textile imports were prepared to react U S Administration already distanced itself bill EC External Trade Commissioner Willy De Clercq written to his U S Counterpart Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter outlining EC s concerns statement ministers were very disturbed by U S Moves towards protectionism The adoption such measures fail to negative effect on process multilateral negotiations just started as well as on bilateral relations Any unilateral U S Moves leave EC no option but to react according to laws General Agreement on Tariffs Trade separate statement on Japan EC ministers they deplore continued aggravation imbalance trade and expect Japan to open up market more statement EC continue to insist Japan boost imports stimulate domestic demand Ministers also called on EC Commission to prepare report on U S Japanese trade July year to enable them to take appropriate action where necessary One diplomat call report showed ministers were determined to let Japanese question drop It be back on table again again diplomat De Clercq talking to journalists during meeting There certain nervousness growing impatience within Community concerning trade relations Japan But diplomats EC keen to negotiate Tokyo to solve problem rather than embark on costly damaging trade war ministers called more cooperation Japan industry research

reuters.unknown: RM f reute b f BC U K BUDGET SEES

text.title: U K BUDGET SEES GDP GROWTH AT THREE PCT
text.body: Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson presenting his budget fiscal to Parliament U K Economic growth forecast at three pct calendar He Treasury expected current account balance payments deficit billion stg after billion shortfall Inflation expected to be pct at end year Lawson As I forecast Autumn Statement inflation may continue to edge up time perhaps exceeding pct by summer before falling back to pct by end year he added Turning to Public Sector Borrowing Requirement PSBR Lawson likely outturn fiscal billion stg or pct GDP planned PSBR set at billion stg On monetary policy Lawson confirmed target range narrow M measure be two to six pct fiscal No explicit target set broad sterling M aggregate he But broad money continue to be taken into account assessing monetary conditions as course exchange rate Chancellor told Parliament Lawson low outturn PSBR is chiefly attributable to remarkable buoyancy non oil tax revenues general corporation tax paid by increasingly profitable business sector particular On oil prices Lawson he sticking to his earlier assumption North Sea crude prices average dlrs per barrel calendar He it clear increased flow non oil tax revenues coupled prospective further growth economy excess growth public expenditure puts public finances very strong position Lawson Treasury strive to keep PSBR at pct GDP future We reached what I judge to be Medium Term Financial Strategy s appropriate destination PSBR pct GDP My aim be to keep there over years ahead Lawson Inevitably greatly diminishes scope I year reducing burden taxation course remains major objective government policy But I am sure right to err on side prudence caution to build still firmer base future Lawson time come to strike Exchange Control Act Statute book On corporation tax he rate remain unchanged at pct But companies capital gains be charged at appropriate corporation tax rate He under new proposed system companies should be able to set Advanced Capital Tax ACT payments against tax on capital gains Taken together these changes should yield stg Lawson Lawson he propose all companies building societies be treated same way on payment corporation tax with all liable to pay corporation tax nine months after end accounting period on tax due I also propose to legislate now to pave way new method collecting corporation tax to be known as Pay File be part wider programme streamlining tax collection come into force until early s Lawson he planned two reliefs on Petroleum Revenue Tax PRT As today companies may elect to up to pct costs developing certain new fields set against their PRT liabilities existing fields until income those new fields exceeds costs incurred Second there be new relief against PRT spending on research into U K Oil extraction related to any particular field On business employment Lawson employers receive tax relief retraining workers Lawson future traders registered Value Added Tax VAT be able to choose to account tax on basis cash paid received Small businesses may account VAT annually instead quarterly VAT compulsory registration period being extended to days he added VAT registration thresholds to be raised to stg New measures planned to combat VAT avoidance he added capital gains tax retirement relief limit now be set at stg Lawson he proposed to change law so companies multinational groups dual residence no longer be able to secure tax relief twice on same interest payment change take effect on April but genuine trading companies be affected He also planned to end present treatment tax credit relief foreign withholding tax paid on interest on bank loans also April In future banks be able to offset tax credit only against tax on profit on relevant loan he standard rate taxation being reduced by two pence to pct pct Lawson reiterated government s aim reducing basic taxation to pence pound but added given my decision to use greater part fiscal scope I now to reduce PSBR goal cannot be achieved budget Small companies corporation tax also being reduced to pct he On Lloyd s insurance market Lawson he planned to change tax treatment Lloyd s syndicates bringing into line provisions outstanding liabilities made by ordinary insurance companies comparable provisions made by financial traders Inland Revenue be told to consult urgently Lloyd s details legislation he The new rules first apply to premiums payable Lloyd s account closes on December year Lawson MORE
